en: At these words, seemingly in response to them, a sudden wail sounded, a terrible, drawn-out cry of misery and pain. Many of those at the table looked downward, startled, for the sound had seemed to issue from below their feet.
en_results: "title": "The Lord of the Rings", "author": "J.R.R. Tolkien"
vi: Dường như để đáp lại những lời này, một tiếng khóc thét thình lình rống lên, một tiếng sầu khổ và đau đớn khủng khiếp kéo dài. Nhiều người trong đám ngồi quanh bàn ngó xuống sàn, kinh ngạc, bởi vì âm thanh đó dường như phát ra từ phía dưới chân họ.
tr: Bu sözlerle birlikte, görünüşe bakılırsa ona cevap olarak, ani bir feryat sesi geldi; korkunç, acı bir haykırış. Masadakilerin birçoğu hayretle aşağı baktı, çünkü ses ayaklarının altından geliyormuş gibiydi.
es: En cuanto hubo pronunciado estas palabras y como en respuesta a ellas, se oyó un gemido desgarrador, un terrible y prolongadísimo alarido de angustia y dolor. Asustados, muchos de los presentes miraron el suelo, porque el sonido parecía provenir de debajo de sus pies.
es_results: "title": "El Amante de las Oscuras", "author": "Ramón María del Valle-Inclán"
vi_translation: As if in response to these words, a sudden scream erupted, a prolonged wail of sorrow and terrible pain. Many people sitting around the table looked down at the floor, astonished, because the sound seemed to come from beneath their feet.
tr_translation: With these words, apparently in response to him, came a sudden cry; a terrible, painful scream. Many of those at the table looked down in astonishment, for the sound seemed to be coming from beneath their feet.
es_translation: As soon as these words were spoken, and as if in response to them, a heart-wrenching moan was heard, a terrible and prolonged scream of anguish and pain. Frightened, many of those present looked at the ground, because the sound seemed to come from beneath their feet.
st: Ka mantsoe ana, ho bonahala eka ba arabela, ho ile ha utloahala lerata la tšohanyetso, sello se tšabehang, se huloang sa bomalimabe le bohloko. Ba bangata ba tafoleng ba ne ba shebile tlaase, ba qala, hobane molumo o ne o bonahala o le ka tlase ho maoto a bona.

en: “Yes, m-my Lord,” gasped a small man halfway down the table, who had been sitting so low in his chair that it appeared, at first glance, to be unoccupied. Now he scrambled from his seat and scurried from the room, leaving nothing behind him but a curious gleam of silver.
en_results: "title": "The Hound of the Baskervilles", "author": "Arthur Conan Doyle"
vi: “Dạ, thưa… thưa Chúa Tể,” một người đàn ông nhỏ thó ngồi khoảng giữa bàn nói. Hắn ngồi lọt thỏm trong ghế, thấp đến nỗi thoáng nhìn qua cái ghế có vẻ như không có người ngồi. Giờ đây hắn lập cập rời khỏi chỗ, lật đật chạy ra khỏi phòng, chẳng để lại gì phía sau ngoại trừ một vết sáng bạc kỳ lạ.
tr: "Evet, Lordum," dedi, masanın ortalarında oturan ufak bir adam nefes nefese. Sandalyesinde o kadar alçakta oturuyorduki ilk bakışta sandalye boş gibi görünüyordu. O an yerinden fırladı ve ardında gümüşi, merak uyandıran bir parıltıdan başka bir şey bırakmadan aceleyle odadan dışarı çıktı.
es: —Sí, m... mi señor —respondió resollando un individuo bajito situado hacia la mitad de la mesa; estaba tan hundido en su silla que, a primera vista, ésta parecía desocupada. Se levantó del asiento y salió a toda prisa de la sala, dejando tras de sí un extraño resplandor plateado.
es_results: "title": "El Señor de los Cielos", "author": "Miguel Ángel Asturias"
vi_translation: “Yes, my Lord… my Lord,” a small man sitting around the middle of the table said. He sat so deep in the chair, so short that at a glance it seemed like there was no one sitting in the chair. Now he shakily left his seat, hurriedly ran out of the room, leaving nothing behind except a strange silver streak.
tr_translation: "Yes, my Lord," said a small man sitting in the middle of the table, out of breath. He was sitting so low in his chair that at first glance it looked like the chair was empty. At that moment, he jumped up and hurried out of the room, leaving behind nothing but a silvery, intriguing shimmer.
es_translation: —Yes, m... my lord —responded a short individual, panting, situated towards the middle of the table; he was so sunk into his chair that, at first glance, it seemed unoccupied. He got up from the seat and hurried out of the room, leaving behind a strange silver glow.
st: "Ee, Morena oa ka," ha khasa monna e monyenyane a theoha tafoleng, ea neng a lutse a le tlase setulong sa hae hoo e ileng ea bonahala, ka lekhetlo la pele, ho se tsotelle. Joale o ile a sotha setulong sa hae 'me a scurried ho tloha kamoreng, siea letho ka mor'a hae haese gleam ea silevera e bohelehele.
yo: "Bẹ́ẹ̀ ni, m-My Lord," gbé ọkùnrin kékeré kan ní ààbọ̀ tábìlì, ẹni tí ó ti jókòó sí ìsàlẹ̀ lórí àga rẹ̀ débi pé ó farahàn, ní ìwò àkọ́kọ́, láti jẹ́ aláìlò. Ní báyìí ó sáré láti orí ìjókòó rẹ̀ ó sì sáré kúrò nínú yàrá náà, kò fi nkankan sílẹ̀ lẹ́yìn rẹ̀ bí kò ṣe ìmọ́lẹ̀ fàdákà tó yani lẹ́nu.
tn: "Ee, monghadi," ha rialo monna ya neng a dutse fatshe, a dutse fatshe setulong sa hae moo a neng a bonahala, ka lekgetlo la pele, hore a se ke a se bona. O ne a se na go tswa mo phaposing ya gagwe, a se ka a tlogela sepe fa morago ga gagwe fa e se sekgatshi sa selefera e e gakgamatsang.

en: “My Lord,” said a dark woman halfway down the table, her voice constricted with emotion, “it is an honor to have you here, in our family’s house. There can be no higher pleasure.”
en_results: "title": "A Court of Thorns and Roses", "author": "Sarah J. Maas"
vi: “Thưa Chúa Tể,” một người đàn bà u ám ngồi khoảng giữa cái bàn với giọng nói dồn nén cảm xúc, “chúng em rất vinh dự được đón ngài tại đây, trong gia đình chúng em. Không thể có niềm vui sướng nào lớn hơn được.”
tr: "Lordum," dedi masanın ortalarındaki karanlık bir kadın. Sesi duyguyla doluydu, "sizi burada, aile evimizde konuk etmek bir şeref. Daha üstün bir memnuniyet olamaz .
es: —Mi señor —dijo con voz emocionada una mujer morena situada hacia la mitad de la mesa—, es un honor alojaros aquí, en la casa de nuestra familia. Nada podría complacernos más.
es_results: "title": "Don Segundo Sombra", "author": "Ricardo Guiraldes"
vi_translation: "My Lord," said a somber woman sitting around the middle of the table with a voice filled with suppressed emotion, "we are very honored to welcome you here, in our family." "There can be no greater joy."
tr_translation: "My lord," said a dark woman from the middle of the table. Her voice was filled with emotion, "it is an honor to host you here, in our family home. There could be no greater satisfaction."
es_translation: —My lord —said a dark-haired woman situated towards the middle of the table with an emotional voice—, it is an honor to host you here, in our family's house. Nothing could please us more.
st: "Morena," ha rialo mosadi e mong ya lefifi a theoha tafoleng, lentswe la hae le ne le tletse maikutlo, "Ke tlotla ho ba le lona mona, tlung ya lelapa la rona. Ho ke ke ha e-ba le thabo e phahameng haholo. "

en: “Darling Dodgy! I remember interviewing him a few years back about merpeople rights, bless him. Completely gaga, seemed to think we were sitting at the bottom of Lake Windermere, kept telling me to watch out for trout.”
en_results: "title": "The Wee Free Men", "author": "Diana Wynne Jones"
vi: “Dodgy đáng yêu thật! Tôi nhớ từng phỏng vấn ổng cách đây vài năm về ngư nhân quyền, trời đất ơi. Hoàn toàn lẩm cẩm, hình như ổng nghĩ chúng tôi đang ngồi dưới đáy hồ Windermere hay sao ấy, cứ bảo tôi phải coi chừng lũ cá hồi.”
tr: "Sevgili Dodgy! Birkaç yıl önce onunla deniz insanları hakları konusunda röportaj yaptığımı hatırlıyorum, tanrı onu korusun. Tamamen üşütük, Windermere Gölü‘nün dibinde oturduğumuzu sanıyor görünüyordu. Bana sürekli alabalıklara dikkat etmemi söyleyip durdu.
es: «¡El bueno de Dodgy! Recuerdo que hace unos años lo entrevisté acerca de los derechos de la gente del agua. ¡Pobre hombre! Estaba completamente ido; al parecer creía que nos hallábamos sentados en el fondo del lago Windermere, y no paraba de decirme que estuviera atenta por si veía alguna trucha.»
es_results: "title": "El buen salvaje", "author": "Robert Louis Stevenson"
vi_translation: “Dodgy is really adorable! I remember interviewing him a few years ago about fishermen's rights, oh my god. Completely senile, it seemed like he thought we were sitting at the bottom of Lake Windermere or something, kept telling me to watch out for the salmon.”
tr_translation: "Dear Dodgy! I remember interviewing him about the rights of sea people a few years ago, God bless him. He seemed completely nuts, thinking we were sitting at the bottom of Lake Windermere. He kept telling me to watch out for the trout."
es_translation: "Good old Dodgy!" I remember that a few years ago I interviewed him about the rights of the water people. Poor man! He was completely gone; apparently, he believed that we were sitting at the bottom of Lake Windermere, and he kept telling me to watch out in case I saw any trout.
st: hahaha dodgy! Ke hopola ho buisana le eena lilemong tse 'maloa morao mabapi le litokelo tsa Merpeople, mo hlohonolofatsa. Ka ho feletseng gaga, o ne a bonahala a nahana hore re lutse ka tlase ho Letša la Windermere, o ile a mpolella hore ke shebe trout. "

en: “Change of plan,” growled Mad-Eye, who was holding two enormous bulging sacks, and whose magical eye was spinning from darkening sky to house to garden with dizzying rapidity. “Let’s get undercover before we talk you through it.”
en_results: "title": "Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi: “Kế hoạch có thay đổi,” Mắt-Điên làu bàu, thầy đang cầm hai bao gì phình căng bự chảng, và con mắt pháp thuật của thầy đảo từ bầu trời đang tối dần đến ngôi nhà rồi khu vườn với độ nhanh chóng mặt. “Bảo mật trước đã rồi giải thích mọi chuyện cho con sau.”
tr: "Plan değişikliği," diye hırladı Deli-Göz, elinde iki kocaman, şişkin torba taşıyordu ve sihirli gözü baş döndürücü bir hızla kararan gökyüzünden eve ve bahçeye kaymıştı. "Bunun hakkında konuşmadan önce korunaklı bir yere geçelim.
es: —Ha habido un cambio de planes —gruñó Ojoloco, que llevaba dos grandes sacos repletos y cuyo ojo mágico enfo-caba alternativamente el oscuro cielo, la casa y el jardín con una rapidez asombrosa—. Pongámonos a cubierto y luego te lo explicaremos todo.

vi_translation: “The plan has changed,” Mad-Eye grumbled, holding two large, bulging bags, and his magical eye darted from the darkening sky to the house and then the garden with astonishing speed. “Security first, explanations later.”
tr_translation: "Plan change," growled Mad-Eye, carrying two huge, bulging bags, and his magical eye had shifted from the rapidly darkening sky to the house and garden at a dizzying speed. "Let's move to a secure place before we talk about this."
es_translation: —There has been a change of plans —growled Mad-Eye, who was carrying two large stuffed sacks and whose magical eye was alternately focusing on the dark sky, the house, and the garden with astonishing speed—. Let's take cover and then we'll explain everything to you.

en: The broomstick spun too, but he just managed to seize the strap of his rucksack and the top of the cage as the motorbike swung the right way up again. A second's relief, and then another burst of green light. The owl screeched and fell to the floor of the cage.
en_results: "title": "Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi: Cây chổi bay mòng mòng xuống đất, nhưng nó chỉ xoay sở túm được cái đai của ba lô và cái nóc lồng khi chiếc xe gắn máy xoay trở về vị trí ban đầu. Mới hú vía được một giây thì một đợt lửa xanh lè khác lại bùng lên. Con cú rít lên và ngã lăn quay xuống đáy lồng.
tr: Süpürge yeryüzüne fırladı, fakat motosiklet aynı şekilde yukarı doğru çıkmaya başlarken sırt çantasının kayışından ve kafesin üstünden yakalamayı başardı. Bir anlığına içi rahatlamıştı ama hemen sonra başka bir yeşil ışık patladı. Baykuş acı ve tiz bir şekilde öttü ve kafesin zeminine düştü .
es: La escoba cayó girando sobre sí misma, pero Harry consiguió atrapar el asa de la mochila y sujetar la jaula, al mismo tiempo que la motocicleta volvía a girar y se coloca-ba en la posición correcta. Hubo un segundo de alivio... y luego otro destello de luz verde. La lechuza chilló y se desplomó en la jaula.
es_results: "title": "Harry Potter y la piedra filosofal", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi_translation: The broom swooped down to the ground, but it only managed to grab the strap of the backpack and the top of the cage when the motorcycle returned to its original position. Just a second after the scare, another burst of green flames flared up. The owl screeched and fell to the bottom of the cage.
tr_translation: The broom flew to the ground, but as the motorcycle began to rise in the same way, he managed to catch it by the strap of the backpack and the top of the cage. For a moment, he felt relieved, but then another green light flashed. The owl hooted in pain and fell to the bottom of the cage.
es_translation: The broom fell spinning on itself, but Harry managed to grab the handle of the backpack and hold onto the cage, at the same time as the motorcycle spun back and positioned itself correctly. There was a second of relief... and then another flash of green light. The owl screeched and collapsed in the cage.

en: The minutes stretched into what might as well have been years. The slightest breath of wind made them all jump and turn toward the whispering bush or tree in the hope that one of the missing Order members might leap unscathed from its leaves –
en_results: "title": "The Hunger Games", "author": "Suzanne Collins"
vi: Từng phút dài ra như cả năm trường. Làn gió thoảng nhẹ nhất cũng khiến tất cả giật mình hướng về phía lùm bụi hay cây cỏ lao xao, hy vọng một trong những Hội viên có thể từ trong đám lá nhảy ra bình yên vô sự…
tr: Dakikalar sanki yıllar gibi geçmişti. Rüzgârın en hafif esintisiyle bile içleri cız ediyor ve sanki eksik olan Yoldaşlık üyeleri yaralanmamış halde yaprakların arasından fırlayacakmış gibi her fısıldayan ağaca ya da çalıya dönüyorlardı.
es: Los minutos transcurrían con una lentitud insoportable. De repente, un leve susurro los sobresaltó, y todos se giraron para comprobar si se había movido algún arbusto o un árbol, con la esperanza de ver asomar entre su follaje, ileso, a otro miembro de la Orden.
es_results: "title": "El Señor de los Anillos", "author": "J.R.R. Tolkien"
vi_translation: Each minute stretched out like a whole year. The slightest breeze made everyone startle and look towards the rustling bushes or grass, hoping that one of the members might jump out from the leaves safe and sound...
tr_translation: Minutes had passed as if they were years. Even the slightest breeze made their hearts ache, and they turned to every whispering tree or bush as if the missing Fellowship members would emerge unscathed from the leaves.
es_translation: The minutes passed with unbearable slowness. Suddenly, a faint whisper startled them, and they all turned to see if any bush or tree had moved, hoping to see another member of the Order emerge unscathed from its foliage.

en: “I’m so sorry to break up this cozy little gathering,” she said, her voice trembling. “I’m sure you all need your rest . . . but there are wedding presents stacked in my room that need sorting out and I was under the impression that you had agreed to help.”
en_results: "title": "Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi: “Tôi rất tiếc phải giải tán cuộc họp mặt thân ái nho nhỏ này,” bà nói giọng run run, “Tôi biết là tất cả các anh chị cần nghỉ ngơi… nhưng quà cưới còn chất đống trong phòng tôi giờ cần phải sắp xếp, mà tôi lại cứ có cảm tưởng là các anh chị đã đồng ý giúp đỡ rồi chớ.”

tr: "Bu sıcak, küçük buluşmayı böldüğüm için özür dilerim," dedi, sesi titriyordu. "Eminim hepinizin dinlenmeye ihtiyacı var... ama odamda ayrıştırılmayı bekleyen bir yığın düğün hediyesi var ve sizin bana yardım etmek istediğinizi sanıyordum.
es: —Lamento mucho interrumpir esta agradable tertulia —dijo con voz temblorosa—. Ya sé que todos necesitáis descansar, pero en mi habitación hay un montón de regalos de boda que deben clasificarse, y se me ha ocurrido que a lo mejor querríais ayudarme.
es_results: "title": "El cuaderno de Noemí", "author": "Pilar Pariente"
vi_translation: “I am very sorry to have to disband this small friendly gathering,” she said in a trembling voice, “I know that all of you need to rest... but the wedding gifts are still piled up in my room and need to be sorted, and I have the impression that all of you have already agreed to help.”
tr_translation: "I'm sorry to interrupt this warm, little gathering," she said, her voice trembling. "I'm sure you all need some rest... but there's a pile of wedding gifts waiting to be sorted in my room, and I thought you wanted to help me.""
es_translation: —I am very sorry to interrupt this pleasant gathering —he said with a trembling voice—. I know that everyone needs to rest, but in my room there are a lot of wedding gifts that need to be sorted, and I thought that maybe you would like to help me.

en: He was walking along a mountain road in the cool blue light of dawn. Far below, swathed in mist, was the shadow of a small town. Was the man he sought down there, the man he needed so badly he could think of little else, the man who held the answer, the answer to his problem...?
en_results: "title": "The Big Overlord of the Universe", "author": "Unknown"
vi: Nó đang đi dọc theo một con đường núi trong ánh bình minh màu xanh dịu mát. Xa xa bên dưới, phủ trong sương mù, lờ mờ hình ảnh một thị trấn nhỏ. Người đàn ông nó đang tìm có ở dưới đó không, người đàn ông nó cần ghê gớm đến nỗi nó không thể nghĩ đến chút gì khác, người đàn ông nắm lời giải - lời giải cho vấn đề của nó…
tr: Gün doğumunun serin mavi ışığı altında, bir dağ yolu boyunca yürüyordu. Uzaklarda bir yerde, sisle kaplanmış, küçük bir köyün gölgesi vardı. Aradığı adam burada mıydı; başka en ufak bir şey düşünemeyecek kadar fena halde ihtiyaç duyduğu adam, cevabının sahibi olan adam, derdine derman olacak adam...
es: Iba caminando por una carretera de montaña bajo la fría y azulada luz del amanecer. En la distancia, un poco más abajo, se distinguía el contorno de un pueblecito envuelto en la neblina. ¿Estaría allí el hombre al que buscaba? El hombre al que tanto necesitaba que casi no podía pensar en otra cosa, el hombre que tenía la solución a su problema.
es_results: "title": "El Señor de los Anillos", "author": "J.R.R. Tolkien"
vi_translation: It was walking along a mountain road in the gentle cool blue dawn. Far below, shrouded in mist, the faint image of a small town appeared. The man it was looking for, the man it needed so desperately that it couldn't think of anything else, the man who held the solution - the solution to its problem, was he down there?
tr_translation: Under the cool blue light of dawn, he was walking along a mountain path. Somewhere in the distance, there was the shadow of a small village shrouded in mist. Was the man he was looking for here; the man he desperately needed, the man who held the answer, the man who would be the remedy to his troubles...?
es_translation: I was walking along a mountain road under the cold, bluish light of dawn. In the distance, a little further down, the outline of a small village shrouded in mist could be seen. Was the man he was looking for there? The man he needed so much that he could hardly think of anything else, the man who had the solution to his problem.

en: Brightly colored figures were appearing, one by one out of nowhere at the distant boundary of the yard. Within minutes a procession had formed, which began to snake its way up through the garden toward the marquee. Exotic flowers and bewitched birds fluttered on the witches’ hats, while precious gems glittered from many of the wizards’ cravats; a hum of excited chatter grew louder and louder, drowning the sound of the bees as the crowd approached the tent.
en_results: "title": "Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi: Những hình dáng màu sắc rực rỡ đang hiện ra, từng bóng một, đột ngột, ở ranh giới xa xa của khu vườn. Trong một loáng, họ hình thành một đám rước bắt đầu rồng rắn kéo nhau qua khu vườn về phía rạp cưới. Kỳ hoa và dị điểu được ếm bùa chấp chới bay trên nón các nữ phù thủy, trong khi ngọc quý lấp lánh chiếu ra từ cà vạt các pháp sư; tiếng trò chuyện râm ran hào hứng càng lúc càng to, át hết tiếng bầy ong, khi đám rước đến gần rạp.
tr: Arazinin sınırında yokluktan tek tek parlak renkli figürler beliriyordu. Hemen ardından bir dakika içinde bahçedeki çadıra doğru gelmeye başladılar. Egzotik çiçekler ve büyülenmiş kuşlar cadıların şapkalarının üstünden sallanırken, büyücülerin de kravatlarındaki mücevher işlemeler parlıyordu; çadıra yaklaştıkça etraftan arıların seslerini boğan heyecanlı konuşma sesleri yükseliyordu.
es: Unos personajes vestidos con llamativas ropas multicolores iban apareciendo, uno a uno, por el fondo del patio. Pasados unos minutos, ya se había formado una procesión que serpenteó por el jardín en dirección a la carpa. En los sombreros de las brujas revoloteaban flores exóticas y pá- jaros embrujados, mientras que preciosas gemas destellaban en las corbatas de muchos magos. A medida que se aproximaban, el murmullo de voces emocionadas fue intensificándose, hasta ahogar el zumbido de las abejas.
es_results: "title": "El Prisionero del Cielo", "author": "Carlos Ruiz Zafón"
vi_translation: Vividly colored shapes are appearing, one by one, suddenly, at the distant boundary of the garden. In a flash, they form a procession that begins to snake through the garden towards the wedding pavilion. Enchanted exotic flowers and birds flutter above the witches' hats, while precious gems sparkle from the wizards' ties; the excited chatter grows louder, drowning out the buzzing of the bees, as the procession approaches the pavilion.
tr_translation: At the edge of the land, bright-colored figures were emerging one by one from the void. Immediately after, within a minute, they started heading towards the tent in the garden. As exotic flowers and enchanted birds swayed above the witches' hats, the jeweled embroideries on the wizards' ties sparkled; as they approached the tent, the excited chatter drowned out the buzzing of the bees around.
es_translation: Some characters dressed in striking multicolored clothes were appearing, one by one, at the back of the courtyard. After a few minutes, a procession had already formed that wound through the garden towards the tent. Exotic flowers fluttered on the witches' hats and pa- haunted jars, while precious gems sparkled on the ties of many wizards. As they approached, the murmur of excited voices grew louder, drowning out the buzzing of the bees.

en: “‘Recent research undertaken by the Department of Mysteries reveals that magic can only be passed from person to person when Wizards reproduce. Where no proven Wizarding ancestry exists, therefore, the so-called Muggle-born is likely to have obtained magical power by theft or force.
en_results: "title": "Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi: “Nghiên cứu gần đây do Sở Bí Mật thực hiện cho thấy pháp thuật chỉ có thể truyền từ cá nhân sang cá nhân khi phù thủy sinh sản. Vì vậy, một khi không chứng minh được dòng dõi phù thủy, kẻ-gọi-là phù thủy gốc Muggle rất có thể đã có được quyền năng pháp thuật bằng cách trộm cắp hay cưỡng đoạt.
vi_results: "title": "Harry Potter và Phòng Phim Bùa Ngủ", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
tr: "Yakındaki soruşturma, büyünün yalnızca büyücüler üreyince kişiden kişiye geçtiği belirtilerek Esrar Dairesi tarafından üstlenildi. Kanıtlanmış büyücü ataları olmadığına göre, Muggle-doğumlu denenler, büyü gücünü hırsızlık yoluyla ya da zor kullanarak almışlardır.
es: Una investigación reciente realizada por el Departamento de Misterios revela que la magia sólo puede transmitirse entre magos mediante la re-producción. Por lo tanto, si no existen antepasados mágicos comprobados, es posible que los llamados «hijos de muggles» hayan obtenido sus poderes má- gicos por medios ilícitos, como el robo o el empleo de la fuerza.
es_results: "title": "Harry Potter y la Piedra Filosofal", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi_translation: “Recent research conducted by the Department of Mysteries shows that magic can only be passed from individual to individual when a witch or wizard reproduces. Therefore, if one cannot prove their wizarding lineage, so-called Muggle-born witches and wizards very likely obtained their magical powers through theft or coercion.
tr_translation: "The nearby investigation was undertaken by the Department of Mysteries, stating that magic is passed from person to person only when wizards reproduce. Since they have no proven wizard ancestors, those called Muggle-born must have acquired their magical power through theft or coercion.
es_translation: A recent investigation conducted by the Department of Mysteries reveals that magic can only be transmitted between wizards through reproduction. Therefore, if there are no proven magical ancestors, it is possible that the so-called "muggle-borns" have obtained their powers ma- goods by illicit means, such as theft or the use of force.
st: Patlisiso ea morao-rao e entsoeng ke Lefapha la Liphiri e senola hore boloi bo ka fetisoa feela ho tloha ho motho ho ea ho motho ha Wizards e ikatisa. en: “You have only ever seen me amongst the Order, or under Dumbledore’s protection at Hogwarts! You don’t know how most of the Wizarding world sees creatures like me! When they know of my affliction, they can barely talk to me! Don’t you see what I’ve done?
en_results: "title": "Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi: “Các người chỉ nhìn thấy tôi ở trong Hội, hay dưới sự che chở của cụ Dumbledore ở trường Hogwarts! Các người không biết phần lớn thế giới pháp thuật nhìn những sinh vật như chúng tôi như thế nào! Khi họ biết cái họa mà tôi phải mang, họ không thể nào vô tư nói chuyện với tôi! Các người không thấy tôi đã làm gì sao?
vi_results: "title": "Harry Potter và Phòng Tù Nhân Tối", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
tr: "Beni yalnızca Yoldaşlık içinde gördünüz, ya da Hogwarts‘ta Dumbledore‘un koruması altında! Büyücülük dünyasının çoğunluğunun benim gibi yaratıkları ne olarak gördüklerini bilmiyorsunuz! Sıkıntımı öğrendikleri zaman benimle zar zor konuşuyorlar! Ne yaptığımı görmüyor musunuz?
es: ¡Tú sólo me has visto rodeado de miembros de la Orden, o en Hogwarts, bajo la protección de Dumbledore! ¡Pero no sabes qué piensa la mayoría del mundo mágico de las criaturas como yo! ¡Los que conocen mi condición apenas me dirigen la palabra! ¿No te das cuenta de lo que he hecho?
es_results: "title": "Harry Potter y el Prisionero de Azkaban", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi_translation: “You only see me in the Order, or under Dumbledore's protection at Hogwarts! You don't know how most of the wizarding world views creatures like us! When they know the curse I bear, they can't casually talk to me! Don't you see what I've done?”
tr_translation: "You have only seen me within the Order, or under Dumbledore's protection at Hogwarts! You don't know what the majority of the wizarding world sees creatures like me as! When they learn about my condition, they barely speak to me! Don't you see what I'm doing?
es_translation: You've only seen me surrounded by members of the Order, or at Hogwarts, under Dumbledore's protection! But you don't know what the majority of the magical world thinks of creatures like me! Those who know my condition barely speak to me! Don't you realize what I've done?
st: "Ke uena feela ea kileng a mpona har'a Order, kapa tlas'a ts'ireletso ea Dumbledore ho Hogwarts! Ha u tsebe hore na boholo ba lefats'e la wizarding bo bona libopuoa tse kang nna! Ha ba tseba mahlomola a ka, ba ke ke ba bua le 'na. Ha le bone seo ke se entseng?
yo: "O ti ri mi nikan laarin awọn Order, tabi labẹ Dumbledore ká Idaabobo ni Hogwarts! O kò mọ bí ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ayé Wizarding ṣe rí àwọn ẹ̀dá bí èmi! Nígbà tí wọ́n bá mọ̀ nípa ìpọ́njú mi, wọn kò fi bẹ́ẹ̀ lè bá mi sọ̀rọ̀! Ṣé o ò rí ohun tí mo ti ṣe ni?
tn: "O kile wa mpona ke le nosi fela ke le mo gare ga taelo, kgotsa ka fa tlase ga tshireletso ya ga Sedore kwa Hogwarts! "Ga o itse gore bontsi jwa batho ba ba tshwanang le nna ga ba itse gore ke eng se se dirang gore batho ba nne le moya o o tshwanang le nna. Fa ba itse pitlagano ya me, ba ka se kgone go bua le nna. Ga o bone se ke se dirileng?
ty: " Ua ite a'enei oe ia'u i rotopu i te Mau Momoni, e aore râ, i raro a'e i te parururaa a Dumbledore i Hogwarts ! Aita outou i ite e, eaha te rahiraa o te mau mea e tupu nei i roto i te ao nei o te hi'o nei i te mau mea ora mai ia'u nei ! Ia ite ana'e ratou i to'u ati, e mea fifi roa no ratou ia paraparau mai ia'u ! Aita anei oe e ite ra i te ohipa ta'u i rave ?
mai: "अहाँ हमरा कहियो आदेशक बीच, या हॉगवर्ट्समे डम्बलडोरक संरक्षणमे देखलहुँ! अहां नहि जनैत छी जे विजार्डिंग दुनियाक अधिकांश भाग हमरा सन जीवकेँ कोना देखैत अछि! जखन ओ हमरा कष्टक बारेमे जनैत छथि तखन ओ हमरा सँ मुश्किल सँ गप्प कऽ सकैत छथि! की अहां नहि देखैत छी जे हम की केलहुं?
mg: "Tsy mbola nahita ahy afa-tsy teo anivon'ny Order, na teo ambany fiarovan'i Dumbledore tao Hogwarts! en: As August wore on, the square of unkempt grass in the middle of Grimmauld Place shriveled in the sun until it was brittle and brown. The inhabitants of number twelve were never seen by anyone in the surrounding houses, and nor was number twelve itself. The muggles who lived in Grimmauld Place had long since accepted the amusing mistake in the numbering that had caused number eleven to sit beside number thirteen.
en_results: "title": "Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi: Đến cuối tháng tám, vuông sân cỏ mọc tùm lum ở giữa quảng trường Grimmauld đã héo queo trong nắng đến mức giòn rụm và nâu xỉn. Cư dân trong ngôi nhà số mười hai hoàn toàn vô hình dưới mắt những người sống trong những ngôi nhà chung quanh. Bản thân ngôi nhà số mười hai cũng vô hình. Từ lâu dân Muggle sống ở quảng trường Grimmauld đã chấp nhận sự nhầm lẫn thú vị trong việc đánh số nhà khiến cho nhà số mười một nằm ngay cạnh nhà số mười ba.
vi_results: "title": "Harry Potter và Phòng Tù Tù", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
tr: Ağustos yavaşça geçtiğinde, Grimmauld Meydanı‘nın ortasındaki bakımsız çimler güneşte gevrekleşene kadar pörsüdü ve sarardı. Ne On İki Numara‘nın sakinleri ne de On İki Numara'nın kendisi, civar evlerde yaşayan bir kimse tarafından görülüyordu. Grimmauld Meydanı‘nda yaşayan Muggle‘lar çoktan “On Bir” numaranın yanında “On Üç” numaranın yer almasının komik bir hata olduğunu kabullenmişlerdi.
es: A medida que avanzaba agosto, el descuidado rectángulo de césped que había en el centro de Grimmauld Place iba marchitándose al sol hasta quedar reseco y marrón. Los muggles que vivían en las casas vecinas de esa plaza nunca habían visto a los inquilinos del número 12 ni la casa en sí, pero hacía mucho tiempo que habían aceptado el gracioso error de numeración, en virtud del cual los números 11 y 13 eran colindantes.
es_results: "title": "Harry Potter y el Prisionero de Azkaban", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi_translation: By the end of August, the patch of grass growing wildly in the middle of Grimmauld Square had withered in the sun to the point of becoming brittle and dull brown. The residents of number twelve were completely invisible to those living in the surrounding houses. The house number twelve itself was also invisible. The Muggles living in Grimmauld Place have long accepted the curious numbering error that places house number eleven right next to house number thirteen.
tr_translation: As August slowly passed, the neglected grass in the middle of Grimmauld Place withered and turned yellow until it crisped in the sun. Neither the residents of Number Twelve nor Number Twelve itself were seen by anyone living in the surrounding houses. The Muggles living in Grimmauld Place had long accepted that the presence of "Number Thirteen" next to "Number Eleven" was a comical mistake.
es_translation: As August progressed, the neglected rectangle of grass in the center of Grimmauld Place withered under the sun until it became dry and brown. The Muggles who lived in the neighboring houses of that square had never seen the occupants of number 12 nor the house itself, but they had long accepted the amusing numbering error, by virtue of which numbers 11 and 13 they were adjacent.
st: Ha August e ne e apere, sekwere sa joang bo ke keng ba lekanngoa bohareng ba Grimmauld Place shriveled letsatsing ho fihlela e ne e le brittle le sootho. 12Ba ahileng palo e leshome le metso e mmedi ha ba a ka ba bonwa ke motho leha e le ofe ka matlung a potapotileng, leha e le ba leshome le metso e mmedi. Batho ba neng ba lula Grimmauld Place ba bile le nako e telele ho tloha ha ba amohela phoso e monate ho palo e neng e bakile palo ea leshome le motso o mong ho lula ka thoko ho nomoro ea leshome le metso e meraro.
yo: Bí oṣù kẹjọ ṣe ń lọ lọ́wọ́, gbàgede koríko tí kò tọ́ ní àárín Grimmauld Place wọ inú oòrùn títí tí yóò fi fọ́ tí ó sì jẹ́ aláwọ̀ brown. Ẹnikẹ́ni tí ó wà ní àyíká kò rí àwọn olùgbé ipò kejìlá rí, bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni kì í ṣe nọ́mbà méjìlá fúnra rẹ̀. Àwọn ìgò tí wọ́n ń gbé ní Grimmauld Place ti gba àṣìṣe ẹlẹ́rìn-ín nínú iye tí ó ti mú kí ipò kọkànlá jókòó lẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́ ipò kẹtàlá.
tn: Ka August e ne e apere, lebala la bojang jo bo se nang bojang mo gare ga Grimmauld Place e ne e shriveled mo letsatsing go fitlha e le bofitlha le borokwa. 12Ba ba 12 ga ba a ka ba bonwa ke ope mo matlong a a mo tikologong, le e seng go nna ba ba 12. Batho ba ba neng ba le mo lefelong la ga Grimmauld ba ne ba sa bolo go amogela phoso e e itumedisang mo palong e e neng ya dira gore palo ya lesome le motso o le mongwe a nne fa thoko ga palo ya lesome le boraro.
ty: A mairi noa ' i te ava'e atete, ua maraa te mahora o te aihere mǎrô i ropu i te Vahi no Grimmauld i nia i te mahana e tae roa ' tu i te taime e mǎrô roa ' i e e uteute roa ' i. Aita te numera ahuru ma piti i itehia a'enei e te hoê taata i roto i te mau fare tapiri mai, e aita atoa te numera ahuru ma piti i itehia. E mea maoro to te mau taata taparahi taata e ora ra i Grimmauld Place fariiraa i te hape arearea i roto i te numera o tei turai i te numera hoê ahuru ma hoê ia parahi i pihai iho i te numera ahuru ma toru.
mai: जेना-जेना अगस्त बढ़ैत गेल, ग्रिमॉल्ड प्लेसक बीचमे अधलाह घासक वर्ग रौदमे सिकुड़ैत रहल जा धरि ई भंगुर आ भूरा नहि भऽ गेल। बारह संख्याक निवासीकेँ लगपासक घरमे कहियो कियो नहि देखलक, आ ने बारह संख्याक छल। ग्रिममॉल्ड प्लेसमे रहनिहार मगलसभ बहुत दिनसँ संख्यामे मनोरंजक गलती स्वीकार कऽ लेने छलाह जाहिसँ एगारह नम्बर तेरह नम्बरक बगलमे बैसल छल।
mg: Rehefa nandeha ny volana Aogositra, dia nivangongo tao anatin'ny masoandro ny kianjan'ny bozaka tsy misy fangarony teo afovoan'ny toerana Grimmauld mandra - pahalevonany sy volontsôkôlà. Ny mponina roa ambin'ny folo lahy dia tsy nisy nahita na dia iray akory aza teo amin'ny manodidina ny trano, ary tsy nisy roa ambin'ny folo lahy teo aminy. Efa ela no nanaiky ilay fahadisoana mampihomehy tamin'ny fanisana izay nahatonga ny laharana iraika ambin'ny folo hipetraka eo akaikin'ny laharana fahatelo ambin'ny folo ireo biby fiompy izay nonina tao amin'ny Grimmauld Place.

en: And yet the square was now attracting a trickle of visitors who seemed to find the anomaly most intriguing. Barely a day passed without one or two people arriving in Grimmauld Place with no other purpose, or so it seemed, than to lean against the railings facing numbers eleven and thirteen, watching the join between the two houses. The lurkers were never the same two days running, although they all seemed to share a dislike for normal clothing. Most of the Londoners who passed them were used to eccentric dressers and took little notice, though occasionally one of them might glance back, wondering why anyone would wear cloaks in this heat.
en_results: "title": "Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi: Ấy vậy mà cái quảng trường đó giờ đây cũng thu hút được một nhúm khách tham quan, những người có vẻ phát hiện ra cái sự không bình thường đó rất ư hấp dẫn. Hiếm có một ngày nào mà không có một hay hai người đến quảng trường Grimmauld chỉ với mục đích (hay có vẻ như với mục đích) đứng dựa vào hàng rào song sắt đối diện nhà số mười một và nhà số mười ba, quan sát chỗ giáp vách giữa hai căn nhà. Mấy tay rình rập đó khác nhau mỗi ngày, mặc dù tất cả dường như có chung cái tính không ưa ăn mặc bình thường. Hầu hết dân Luân Đôn đã quen thấy những người ăn mặc lập dị nên khi đi ngang qua mấy tay đó cũng chẳng thèm để ý đến nữa, nhưng thỉnh thoảng cũng có người liếc nhìn lại, thắc mắc sao lại có người trùm áo choàng trong thời tiết nóng bức thế này.
vi_results: "title": "Harry Potter và Phòng Phim Bí Mật", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
tr: Yine de meydan, hâlâ merak verici anormallikte olan birkaç ziyaretçi çekiyordu. Günde en az bir ya da iki insan sırf ya bu sebepten dolayı Grimmauld Meydanı‘na geliyor, ya da en azından bu sebepten gelmiş gibi görünüyor, yüzlerini “On Bir” ve “On Üç” numaralarına vererek parmaklıklara yaslanıyorlar ve iki evin birleşme noktasını izliyorlardı. Pusuya yatanlar hiç iki gün üst üste aynı değillerdi ve bununla beraber hepsinin de ortak noktasının düzgün bir kıyafetten nefret ettikleri olduğu görünüyordu. Yanlarından geçen Londralılar'ın büyük bölümü bunları eksantrik giysiler olarak görüyor ve bir bakıp geçiyor, yine de bazen bir tanesi neden bir insanın bu sıcakta bu tür bir cüppe giyebileceğini merak edip dönüp tekrar bakıyordu.
es: Y sin embargo, la plaza atraía un goteo de visitantes que, por lo visto, consideraban esa anomalía de lo más intrigante. Así pues, no pasaba ni un día sin que una o dos personas llegaran a Grimmauld Place con el único propósito (al menos aparentemente) de apoyarse en la pequeña valla que cercaba la plaza, frente a los números 11 y 13, y observar la unión de las dos casas. Esos individuos nunca eran los mismos, aunque todos solían vestir de una forma muy rara. La mayoría de los londinenses que pasaban por allí, acostumbrados a ver personajes excéntricos, no se fijaban mucho en ellos, aunque de vez en cuando algún viandante volvía la cabeza y se preguntaba cómo se le ocurría a alguien salir a la calle con una capa tan larga, visto el calor que hacía.
es_results: "title": "Harry Potter y el Prisionero de Azkaban", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi_translation: Yet that square now attracts a handful of visitors, people who seem to find that abnormality very appealing. It is rare for a day to pass without one or two people coming to Grimmauld Square with the sole purpose (or seemingly with the purpose) of leaning against the iron fence opposite numbers eleven and thirteen, observing the junction between the two houses. These lurkers are different each day, although they all seem to share a common dislike for dressing normally. Most Londoners are accustomed to seeing eccentrically dressed people, so they no longer pay attention when passing by these lurkers, but occasionally someone will glance back, wondering why anyone would wear a cloak in such hot weather.
tr_translation: Nevertheless, the square still attracted a few visitors of curious abnormality. At least one or two people a day came to Grimmauld Place just for this reason, or at least seemed to come for this reason, leaning against the railings with their faces turned towards numbers "Eleven" and "Thirteen" and watching the junction of the two houses. The lurkers were never the same two days in a row, and it seemed that all of them shared a common dislike for proper attire. The majority of passing Londoners saw these as eccentric outfits and glanced briefly before moving on, though sometimes one would wonder why a person would wear such a robe in this heat and turn back for another look.
es_translation: And yet, the square attracted a trickle of visitors who, apparently, found this anomaly most intriguing. Thus, not a day went by without one or two people arriving at Grimmauld Place with the sole purpose (at least apparently) of leaning on the small fence that enclosed the square, in front of numbers 11 and 13, and observing the junction of the two houses. These individuals were never the same, although they all tended to dress in a very peculiar manner. Most Londoners passing by, accustomed to seeing eccentric characters, didn't pay much attention to them, although occasionally a passerby would turn their head and wonder how anyone could think of going out with such a long cloak, given the heat.
st: Mme leha ho le joalo, sebaka sena sa marang-rang se ne se hohela baeti ba neng ba bonahala eka ke ntho e makatsang ka ho fetesisa. Ha feela letsatsi le ile la feta ntle le batho ba le mong kapa ba babeli ba fihlang Grimmauld Place ntle le morero o mong, kapa ka hona ho ne ho bonahala eka, ho feta ho itšetleha ka liporo tse tobaneng le linomoro tse leshome le motso o mong le leshome le metso e meraro, ho shebella ho kopanngoa lipakeng tsa matlo a mabeli. Li-lurkers ha li so ka li tšoana matsatsi a mabeli li matha, le hoja kaofela li ne li bonahala li sa rate liaparo tse tloaelehileng. Boholo ba London ba ileng ba feta ba ne ba sebelisoa ho apara liaparo 'me ba nka tsebiso e fokolang, leha ka linako tse ling e mong oa bona a ka 'na a sheba morao, ba ipotsa hore na ke hobane'ng ha mang kapa mang a ka apara liaparo ka mocheso ona.
yo: Síbẹ̀síbẹ̀ gbàgede náà ti ń fa ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn àlejò tí wọ́n dàbí ẹni pé wọ́n rí àṣìṣe tí ó fani mọ́ra jùlọ. Kò fi bẹ́ẹ̀ jẹ́ ọjọ́ kan tí ó kọjá láìsí ènìyàn kan tàbí méjì tí wọ́n dé Grimmauld Place láìsí ìdí mìíràn, tàbí bẹ́ẹ̀ ó jọ bẹ́ẹ̀, ju kí ó gbára lé àwọn ojú ọ̀nà tí nọ́mbà mọ́kànlá àti mẹ́tàlá ń dojú kọ, wíwo àjọṣepọ̀ láàárín àwọn ilé méjèèjì. Àwọn tí wọ́n fi pamọ́ kì í ṣe ọjọ́ méjì kan náà tí wọ́n ń sáré, bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé gbogbo wọn dàbí ẹni pé wọ́n ní ìkórìíra fún aṣọ tí ó dára. Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ará London tí wọ́n kọjá wọn ni wọ́n mọ́ àwọn aṣọ àrà ọ̀tọ̀ tí wọ́n sì ṣe àkíyèsí díẹ̀, bí ó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé lẹ́ẹ̀kọ̀ọ̀kan ọ̀kan nínú wọn lè wo ẹ̀yìn, ó ń ṣe ìyàlẹ́nu ìdí tí ẹnikẹ́ni fi máa wọ aṣọ nínú ooru yìí.
tn: Le fa go ntse jalo, mo nakong eno, go ne go na le batho ba ba neng ba lebega ba le mo tseleng e ba neng ba lebega ba na le yone e e kgatlhang thata. Go ne ga feta letsatsi le le lengwe kgotsa a le mongwe fela kgotsa ba babedi ba ba gorogang kwa Grimmauld ba se na maikaelelo a mangwe, go na le go ikaega ka diporo tse di lebaganeng le dinomoro di le 11 le 13, ba lebile tshwaragano magareng ga matlo a mabedi. Go ne go se ope yo o neng a le mo malatsing a mabedi a a tshwanang, le fa botlhe ba ne ba lebega ba sa rate go apara diaparo tse di tlwaelegileng. Bontsi jwa batho ba ba neng ba le mo go yone ba ne ba le mo tseleng e e neng e le teng, ba ne ba lemoga gore ka dinako tse dingwe ba ne ba ka bona gore ke ka ntlha yang fa ba ne ba ka apara diaparo tse di bothitho tseno.

en: The silver stag soared from the tip of Harry’s wand and leaped toward the dementors, which fell back and melted into the dark shadows again. The stag’s light, more powerful and more warming than the cat’s protection, filled the whole dungeon as it cantered around the room.
en_results: "title": "Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi: Con hươu bạc phóng ra từ đầu cây đũa phép của Harry và nhảy về phía bọn Giám ngục khiến bọn chúng rút lui và lại tan vào bóng tối. Ánh sáng của con hươu mạnh và ấm hơn sức bảo vệ của con mèo, tràn khắp căn hầm khi nó phi quanh phòng.
vi_results: "title": "Harry Potter và Hòn Đá Phục Sinh", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
tr: Gümüş geyik Harry‘nin asasından fırladı ve Ruh Emiciler'i savuşturdu. Patronus geyiğin etkisi kedininkinden çok daha fazlaydı.
es: El ciervo plateado surgió de la varita de Harry y se abalanzó sobre los dementores, que retrocedieron rápidamente hacia la oscuridad. El ciervo trotaba de una punta a otra de la mazmorra y su luz, más poderosa y más cálida que la del gato, iluminó la estancia por completo.
es_results: "title": "Harry Potter y la Piedra Filosofal", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi_translation: The silver stag shot out from the tip of Harry's wand and leaped towards the Dementors, causing them to retreat and dissolve back into the darkness. The light from the stag was stronger and warmer than the protection of the cat, flooding the dungeon as it galloped around the room.
tr_translation: The silver stag shot out from Harry's wand and warded off the Dementors. The effect of the Patronus stag was far greater than that of the cat's.
es_translation: The silver stag emerged from Harry's wand and charged at the dementors, who quickly retreated into the darkness. The stag trotted from one end of the dungeon to the other, and its light, more powerful and warmer than that of the cat, illuminated the entire room.

en: It was as large as a chicken’s egg. An ornate letter S, inlaid with many small green stones, glinted dully in the diffused light shining through the tent’s canvas roof.
en_results: "title": "The Name of the Rose", "author": "Umberto Eco"
vi: Nó bự bằng cái trứng gà. Một chữ S cầu kỳ khắc chìm cùng với nhiều viên đá nhỏ màu xanh biếc, lấp lánh yếu ớt trong ánh sáng khuếch tán chiếu xuyên qua nóc vải bạt của cái lều.
tr: Bir tavuk yumurtası büyüklüğündeydi. Gösterişli bir S harfi, bir çok küçük yeşil taşla işlenmişti, çadırın tepesinden yayılarak gelen ışıktan dolayı donuk bir şekilde parıldıyordu.
es: Era más o menos del tamaño de un huevo de gallina. Una ornamentada «S», con piedrecitas verdes incrustadas, brillaba un poco bajo la difuminada luz que se filtraba por la lona de la tienda.
es_results: "title": "El Aleph", "author": "Jorge Luis Borges"

en: He sat low in one of Perkins's old armchairs, feeling more humiliated by the moment. He was afraid that something had gone wrong inside him. Yesterday seemed a long time ago: Today me might have been thirteen years old again, the only one who collapsed on the Hogwarts Express.
en_results: "title": "Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi: Nó ngồi thụp xuống một trong mấy cái ghế bành cũ của ông Perkins, giờ đây lại càng cảm thấy nhục nhã hơn. Nó sợ là có cái gì đó bị trục trặc trong người nó. Ngày hôm qua dường như cách đây đã lâu lắm rồi: hôm nay có lẽ nó đã trở lại tuổi mười ba một lần nữa, trở thành đứa trẻ duy nhất gục ngã trên chuyến xe lửa tốc hành Hogwarts.
vi_results: "title": "Harry Potter và Phòng Tù Nhân Tử", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
tr: Perkins'in eski sandalyelerinden birine çöktü, kendini daha da utanmış hissederek. içinde bir şeylerin yanlış gittiğinden korkuyordu. Dün, çok uzun zaman önceymiş gibiydi. Bugün Hogwarts Ekspresi'nde, cesaretini yitirmiş ve yeniden on üç yaşında olabilirdi.
es: Se dejó caer en una de las viejas butacas de Perkins; cada vez se sentía más humillado y temía que algún meca-nismo interior hubiera dejado de funcionarle. El día anterior parecía muy lejano; se sentía como si volviera a tener trece años y fuera el único que se desplomaba en el expreso de Hogwarts.
es_results: "title": "Harry Potter y la piedra filosofal", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi_translation: It slumped down into one of Mr. Perkins' old armchairs, now feeling even more humiliated. It was afraid that something was wrong with it. Yesterday seemed like it was a long time ago: today it felt like it had turned thirteen again, becoming the only child to collapse on the Hogwarts Express.
tr_translation: He collapsed into one of Perkins' old chairs, feeling even more ashamed. He was afraid that something was going wrong inside him. Yesterday felt like it was a long time ago. Today on the Hogwarts Express, he could have lost his courage and been thirteen years old again.
es_translation: He let himself fall into one of Perkins' old armchairs; he felt increasingly humiliated and feared that some internal mechanism had stopped working. The previous day seemed very distant; he felt as if he were thirteen again and the only one collapsing on the Hogwarts Express.
st: O ile a lula a le tlase ho e mong oa li-armchairs tsa khale tsa Perkins, o ikutloa a kokobelitsoe ke motsotso ona. O ne a tšaba hore ho na le ho hong ho sa tsamaeeng hantle ka hare ho eena. Maobane e ne e bonahala e le khale: Kajeno ke ne ke le lilemo li leshome le metso e meraro hape, e le 'ngoe feela ea ileng a oela Hogwarts Express.
yo: Ó jókòó sí ìsàlẹ̀ nínú ọ̀kan nínú àwọn àga ọwọ́ Perkins àtijọ́, ó ní ìtìjú púpọ̀ ní àkókò yìí. Ẹ̀rù bà á pé nkan kan ti ṣẹlẹ̀ nínú rẹ̀. Àná dàbí ìgbà pípẹ́ sẹ́yìn: Lónìí mo lè ti jẹ́ ọmọ ọdún mẹ́tàlá lẹ́ẹ̀kan si, ẹni kan ṣoṣo tí ó ṣubú lórí Hogwarts Express.
tn: O ne a ikutlwa a le kwa tlase mo go yo mongwe wa masole a ga Perdiger, a ikutlwa a le bokoa thata ka nako eo. Ka jalo, o ne a boifa gore sengwe ga se a siama mo teng ga gagwe. Go ne go lebega e kete ke ne ke le dingwaga di le 13 tse di fetileng: Gompieno ke ne ke setse ke na le dingwaga di le 13, ke ne ke le nosi fela fa ke ne ke wetse kwa Hogwarts Express.

en: Strung all around with colored lights, there was what looked like a war memorial in the middle, partly obscured by a windblown Christmas tree. There were several shops, a post office, a pub, and a little church whose stained-glass windows were glowing jewel-bright across the square.
en_results: "title": "Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi: Có cái gì đó trông giống như một tượng đài kỷ niệm chiến tranh đứng ngay chính giữa, chung quanh treo lủng lẳng đầy đèn màu, bị che khuất phần nào vì một cây Giáng sinh bị gió thổi bạt. Bên kia quảng trường có nhiều cửa tiệm, một bưu điện, một quán rượu, và một ngôi nhà thờ nhỏ có cửa sổ bằng kiếng màu sáng rực rỡ lóng lánh.
tr: Meydanın her tarafında renkli ışıkların süzüldüğü, şiddetli rüzgârlardan dolayı hafif yan yatmış Noel ağacından dolayı bir kısmı anca görünen savaş anıtına benzeyen bir şey vardı. Meydanda birkaç dükkân, bir postane, bir bar ve meydana mücevher parlaklığında ışık yayan vitray camları olan küçük bir kilise vardı.
es: En medio de la plaza, rodeado de luces de colores ensartadas y parcialmente tapado por un árbol de Navidad sacudido por el viento, se erigía un monumento a los caídos en la guerra. Había varias tiendas, una oficina de correos, un pub y una pequeña iglesia, cuyas vidrieras de colores relucían al otro lado de la plaza.
es_results: "title": "El Quijano", "author": "Miguel Ángel Asín"
vi_translation: There was something that looked like a war memorial standing right in the middle, surrounded by hanging colorful lights, partially obscured by a wind-blown Christmas tree. Across the square, there were many shops, a post office, a pub, and a small church with brightly shining stained glass windows.
tr_translation: There was something resembling a war monument, partially visible due to the Christmas tree, which was slightly tilted because of the strong winds, with colorful lights streaming all around the square. In the square, there were a few shops, a post office, a bar, and a small church with stained glass windows emitting jewel-like brightness.
es_translation: In the middle of the square, surrounded by strings of colorful lights and partially obscured by a Christmas tree shaken by the wind, stood a monument to those who fell in the war. There were several shops, a post office, a pub, and a small church, whose stained glass windows gleamed on the other side of the square.
st: Ho pota-potiloe ke mabone a mebala, ho ne ho bonahala eka ke sehopotso sa ntoa bohareng, se ileng sa koaheloa ke sefate sa Keresemese se fokang ka moea. Ho ne ho e-na le mabenkele a 'maloa, ofisi ea poso, pub, le kereke e nyane eo lifensetere tsa eona tse nang le khalase e khanyang e khanyang ka mose ho sekwere.
yo: Rìn káàkiri pẹ̀lú àwọn iná aláwọ̀, ohun tí ó dàbí ìrántí ogun wà ní àárín, apá kan igi Kérésìmesì tí afẹ́fẹ́ bò ó mọ́lẹ̀. Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ilé ìtajà ló wà, ọ́fíìsì ìfìwéránṣẹ́, ilé ọtí kan, àti ṣọ́ọ̀ṣì kékeré kan tí fèrèsé gíláàsì tí ó ní àbàwọ́n rẹ̀ ń tàn kọjá gbàgede.
tn: Mo godimo ga moo, go ne go na le sengwe se se neng se lebega jaaka segopotso sa ntwa mo gare, se se neng se bonala se le mo gare ga setlhare se se neng se thubega ke setlhare sa Keresemose. Go ne go na le mabenkele a le mmalwa, ofisi ya poso, ntlo le kereke e nnye ya yone e e neng e na le difensetere tse di phatsimang tse di phatsimang go ralala lebala la dikwere.

Te vai ra e rave rahi mau fare toa, te hoê fare rata, te hoê fare rata, e te hoê fare pureraa na'ina'i e te mau hi'o haamaramarama anaana e anaana ra i ni'a i te mahora.

en: They waded deeper and deeper into the graveyard, gouging dark tracks into the snow behind them, stooping to peer at the words on old headstones, every now and then squinting into the surrounding darkness to make absolutely sure that they were unaccompanied.
en_results: "title": "The Shining", "author": "Stephen King"
vi: Tụi nó lội càng lúc càng sâu hơn vô nghĩa trang, vẹt thành những rãnh tối trong tuyết phía sau lưng, lom khom để săm soi những hàng chữ trên dãy bia mộ cũ kỹ, thỉnh thoảng liếc mắt vào bóng tối chung quanh để biết chắc chắn không có ai khác ngoài tụi nó.
tr: Arkalarında karda derin izler oluşturarak, eski mezar taşlarında yazan kelimeleri okuyabilmek için durarak, arada bir yalnız olduklarından kesin olarak emin olmak için kısık gözlerle etraflarındaki karanlığa bakarak mezarlıkta güç bela gittikçe daha da derine gittiler.
es: Se adentraron en el cementerio y continuaron dejando un oscuro rastro en la nieve; iban agachándose para leer las inscripciones de las viejas lápidas, y de vez en cuando escudriñaban la oscuridad circundante para asegurarse de que estaban solos.
es_results: "title": "El Señor de los Anillos", "author": "J.R.R. Tolkien"
vi_translation: They waded deeper and deeper into the cemetery, carving dark furrows in the snow behind them, hunched over to scrutinize the inscriptions on the rows of old tombstones, occasionally glancing into the surrounding darkness to make sure there was no one else but them.
tr_translation: Leaving deep tracks in the snow behind them, stopping to read the words written on the old tombstones, occasionally glancing into the darkness around them with squinted eyes to be absolutely sure they were alone, they struggled to go deeper and deeper into the cemetery.
es_translation: They ventured into the cemetery and continued leaving a dark trail in the snow; they bent down to read the inscriptions on the old tombstones, and occasionally peered into the surrounding darkness to make sure they were alone.

en: It did not stir. He had not expected it to. If it had been that easy the sword would have lain on the ground for him to pick up, not in the depths of a frozen pool. He set off around the circle of ice, thinking hard about the last time the sword had delivered itself to him. He had been in terrible danger then, and had asked for help.
en_results: "title": "The Last Kingdom", "author": "Bernard Cornwell"
vi: Thanh gươm không nhúc nhích. Nó cũng không trông mong điều đó lắm. Nếu dễ ợt như vậy thì thanh gươm cứ việc nằm trên mặt đất cho nó lượm lên, chứ nằm chi dưới đáy hồ đóng băng. Nó bắt đầu đi vòng quanh hồ băng, nghiền ngẫm về cái lần trước đây thanh gươm tự nguyện đặt vào tay nó. Lúc đó nó lâm vào tình huống nguy kịch, và nó đã cầu cứu.
tr: Hareket etmedi. Beklememişti de. Eğer o kadar kolay olsaydı, kılıç alması için yere konulmuş olurdu, donmuş bir havuzun derinlikleride değil. Buz çemberinin etrafında dolandı, kılıcın kendini ona son yollayışını düşünüyordu. O zaman korkunç bir tehlike içindeydi ve yardım istemişti.
es: Pero la espada no se movió, aunque Harry tampoco confiaba en que lo hiciera. Si hubieran querido que fuera así de fácil, no la habría encontrado bajo el agua, sino en el suelo, y la habría cogido sin más. Se puso a andar alrededor del círculo de hielo, tratando de recordar cada detalle de la última vez que la espada se le había entregado. Entonces él estaba amenazado por un gran peligro, y había pedido ayuda.
es_results: "title": "Harry Potter y el Prisionero de Azkaban", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi_translation: The sword did not budge. It did not expect it to, either. If it were that easy, the sword would just lie on the ground for it to pick up, rather than lying at the bottom of a frozen lake. It began to walk around the frozen lake, pondering about the last time the sword willingly placed itself in its hand. At that time, it was in a dire situation, and it had called for help.
tr_translation: He did not move. Nor had he waited. If it were that easy, the sword would have been placed on the ground for him to take, not in the depths of a frozen pool. He circled around the ice ring, thinking about the last time the sword had sent itself to him. At that time, he was in terrible danger and had called for help.
es_translation: But the sword did not move, although Harry did not trust it to do so either. If they had wanted it to be that easy, he would not have found it underwater, but on the ground, and he would have simply picked it up. He began to walk around the circle of ice, trying to remember every detail of the last time the sword had been given to him. Then he was threatened by great danger, and he had asked for help.

en: Contemplating the task ahead would not make it easier or the water warmer. He stepped to the pool's edge and placed Hermione's wand on the ground still lit. Then, trying not to imagine how much colder he was about to become or how violently he would soon be shivering, he jumped.
en_results: "title": "Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi: Toan tính công việc trước cũng chẳng làm cho công việc dễ hơn hay nước ấm hơn. Nó bước tới mép hồ và đặt cây đũa phép vẫn còn thắp sáng trên mặt đất. Sau đó, cố gắng không hình dung xem mình sắp bị lạnh hơn bao nhiêu hay sẽ rùng mình dữ dội đến cỡ nào, nó nhảy ùm xuống.
tr: Önündeki görevi uzun uzun düşünmek işi kolaylaştırmayacaktı, ya da suyu ısıtmayacaktı. Havuzun kenarına doğru adım attı ve Hermione‘nin asasını yere koydu, hala ucu yanıyordu. Sonra, biraz sonra, ne kadar daha üşüyeceğini ya da yakında ne kadar şiddetle titreyeceğini gözünde canlandırmamaya çalışarak, atladı.
es: Pero pensar en la tarea que tenía por delante no la haría más fácil, ni el agua se calentaría, de modo que se acercó al borde de la charca y dejó en el suelo la varita de Hermione, todavía encendida. Entonces, intentando no imaginar que iba a sentir un frío mortal ni lo que llegaría a tiritar, se metió en el agua hasta los hombros.
es_results: "title": "Harry Potter y el Prisionero de Azkaban", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi_translation: Calculating the work beforehand neither makes the work easier nor the water warmer. It stepped to the edge of the lake and placed the still-lit wand on the ground. Then, trying not to imagine how much colder it would get or how violently it would shiver, it jumped in with a splash.
tr_translation: Thinking long and hard about the task ahead wouldn't make it any easier, nor would it heat the water. He stepped towards the edge of the pool and placed Hermione's wand on the ground, its tip still glowing. Then, a moment later, trying not to imagine how much colder he would get or how violently he would soon be shivering, he jumped.
es_translation: But thinking about the task ahead wouldn't make it any easier, nor would the water get any warmer, so he approached the edge of the pond and placed Hermione's still-lit wand on the ground. Then, trying not to imagine the deadly cold he was about to feel or how much he would shiver, he got into the water up to his shoulders.
st: Ha u nahana ka mosebetsi o ka pele ho ne ho ke ke ha etsa hore ho be bonolo kapa ho futhumala ha metsi. O ile a theohela ka nqane ho letamo mme a beha wand ya Hermione fatsheng a ntse a omme. Ka mor'a moo, a se ke a nahana hore na o ne a le motenya hakae kapa hore na o ne a tla ba mabifi hakae haufinyane, o ile a tlolela.
yo: Ṣíṣe àṣàrò nípa iṣẹ́ tó ń bọ̀ kò ní jẹ́ kí ó rọrùn tàbí kí omi lọ́ wọ́ọ́rọ́. Ó tẹ̀síwájú sí etí odò ìwẹ̀ ó sì gbé ọ̀pá Hermione sórí ilẹ̀ ṣì ń tàn. Lẹ́yìn náà, ó ń gbìyànjú láti má fojú inú wo iye òtútù tí ó fẹ́ di tàbí bí ó ṣe máa wárìrì láìpẹ́, ó fò.
tn: Go dira tiro e e kwa pele ga go ka dira gore go nne motlhofo kgotsa go nna le metsi a a kwa tlase. O ne a ya kwa setsheng sa ga Hermione fa fatshe a sa ntse a le mo godimo ga metsi. Ka jalo, o ne a sa akanye gore o ne a le tsididi jang kgotsa gore o tla nna a le mo kotsing ka bonako, o ne a tlolatlola.

en: The cold was agony: It attacked him like fire. His brain itself seemed to have frozen as he pushed through the dark water to the bottom and reached out, groping for the sword. His fingers closed around the hilt; he pulled it upward.
en_results: "title": "The Sword of Shannara", "author": "Terry Brooks"
vi: Cái lạnh cực kỳ tàn khốc: cơn lạnh hành nó không khác gì lửa. Chính cái đầu dường như đã đóng băng ngay khi nó thụp đầu xuống làn nước tối thui, nhắm hướng đáy hồ và vói tay ra, dò tìm thanh gươm. Ngón tay nó siết quanh chuôi gươm; nó rút thanh gươm lên.
tr: Soğuk büyük ıstıraptı: Ona ateş gibi saldırdı. Karanlık su boyunca kendini itip uzanıp kılıcı almak için elini uzatırken beyni de donmuş gibiydi. Parmakları kabzanın etrafında kapandı; yukarı doğru çekti.
es: El frío le propinó un latigazo de dolor lacerante como fuego, y al sumergirse tuvo la impresión de que el cerebro se le congelaba. Buscó a tientas la espada y, por fin, la asió por la empuñadura y tiró de ella.
es_results: "title": "El laberinto de espadas", "author": "Miguel Ángel Asín"
vi_translation: The cold was extremely brutal: the chill tormented him as if it were fire. His head seemed to freeze the moment he ducked into the pitch-black water, aiming for the bottom of the lake and reaching out, searching for the sword. His fingers closed around the hilt of the sword; he pulled the sword up.
tr_translation: The cold was a great torment: It attacked him like fire. As he pushed himself along the dark water and reached out to grab the sword, his brain felt frozen. His fingers closed around the hilt; he pulled it upward.
es_translation: The cold dealt him a lashing pain like fire, and as he submerged, he had the impression that his brain was freezing. He groped for the sword and, finally, grasped it by the hilt and pulled it out.
st: 'Me o ne a le bohloko bo boholo: o ile a mo hlasela joaloka mollo. Boko ba hae ka boeona bo ne bo bonahala bo bata ha a ntse a sutumelletsa metsing a lefifi ho ea tlase 'me a fihla ka ntle, a groping bakeng sa sabole. menoana ea hae e koetsoe ka lehlakoreng le leng; 'Me o ile a mo sutumletsa holimo.
yo: Òtútù náà jẹ́ ìrora: ó kọlu rẹ̀ bí iná. Ọpọlọ rẹ̀ fúnra rẹ̀ dàbí ẹni pé ó ti di dídì bí ó ṣe ń tì omi dúdú sí ìsàlẹ̀ tí ó sì kàn sí ìsàlẹ̀, ó ń fi ọwọ́ kàn idà. Awọn ika ọwọ rẹ ti wa ni pipade ni ayika hilt; Ó fà á sókè.
tn: Serame se ne se mo tlhasela jaaka molelo. Le fa go ntse jalo, o ne a lebega a na le metsi a a tsididi fa a ntse a tsamaya mo metsing a a lefifi mme a fitlha kwa tlase, a phamola ka lerumo. menwana ya gagwe e e mo dikologang; a e tlhatlosa.
ty: E mea to'eto'e roa: E au te reira i te auahi. E au ra e ua toetoe roa to ' na roro iho a turai noa ' i oia na roto i te pape pouri e tae roa ' tu i raro e a toro atu ai i to ' na rima, ma te taueue i te ' o'e. Ua tapiri to'na mau manimani rima i ni'a i te afata ; ua huti oia i te reira i ni'a.

en: Choking and retching, soaking and colder than he had ever been in his life, he came to facedown in the snow. Somewhere, close by, another person was panting and coughing and staggering around, as she had come when the snake attacked....Yet it did not sound like her, not with those deep coughs, no judging by the weight of the footsteps....
en_results: "title": "The Girl with All the Gifts", "author": "M.R. Carey"
vi: Nghẹt thở và ói ộc, ướt nhem và lạnh chưa từng thấy, nó tỉnh lại, mặt úp xuống tuyết. Đâu đó, sát một bên, một người khác đang thở hổn hển, ho sặc sụa và loạng choạng vòng quanh. Hermione đã lại đến, như đã đến khi con mãng xà tấn công… nhưng nghe không có vẻ gì giống Hermione cả, không phải Hermione với những tiếng ho khùng khục đó, càng không phải nếu xét theo tiếng bước chân nặng nề…
vi_results: "title": "Harry Potter và Phòng Tù Nhân Tử", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
tr: Nefesi kesilerek ve böğürerek, sırılsıklam ve hayatında hiç üşümediği kadar üşüyerek, karda yüzükoyun yattı. Yakında biri, başka bir insan hızla nefes alıyordu ve öksürüyordu ve sendeliyordu. Hermione tekrar gelmişti, yılan saldırdığında geldiği gibi... Ama onun sesine benzemiyordu, bu derin öksürükler, ayakların ağırlıkları ona benzemiyordu...
es: Cuando recobró el conocimiento se hallaba boca abajo sobre la nieve, tosiendo y con arcadas, empapado y helado como nunca; cerca de él había alguien que también jadeaba, tosía y se tambaleaba. Supuso que Hermione lo había salvado una vez más, como cuando lo había atacado la serpiente. No obstante, esas toses estentóreas y esos pasos rui-dosos no parecían los de su amiga...
es_results: "title": "Harry Potter y el Prisionero de Azkaban", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi_translation: Choking and vomiting, soaking wet and colder than ever before, it woke up, face down in the snow. Somewhere nearby, someone else was gasping for breath, coughing violently, and staggering around. Hermione had come again, as she had when the serpent attacked… but it didn't sound like Hermione at all, not Hermione with those harsh coughs, and certainly not if you considered the heavy footsteps…
tr_translation: Breathless and moaning, soaking wet and colder than he had ever been in his life, he lay face down in the snow. Nearby, someone else, another person, was breathing rapidly, coughing, and stumbling. Hermione had come again, just as she had when the snake attacked... But it didn't sound like her, these deep coughs, the weight of the footsteps didn't resemble hers...
es_translation: When he regained consciousness, he found himself face down on the snow, coughing and retching, soaked and colder than ever; near him was someone else who was also gasping, coughing, and staggering. He assumed that Hermione had saved him once again, like when the snake had attacked him. However, those loud coughs and noisy footsteps did not seem to belong to his friend...

en: “I did think I saw something move over there, but I was running to the pool at the time, because you'd gone in and you hadn't come up, so I wasn't going to make a detour to -- hey!”
en_results: "title": "The Catcher in the Rye", "author": "J.D. Salinger"
vi: “Mình nghĩ là mình có thấy cái gì đó di chuyển ở đằng kia, nhưng lúc đó mình đang chạy tới cái hồ, bởi vì bồ đã nhảy xuống đó mà không thấy bồ trồi lên, thành ra mình không quay trở lại để… Ê!”
tr: "Orada bir şeyin hareket ettiğini gördüğümü sandım, ama o anda havuza doğru koşuyordum, çünkü içeri girmiştin ve dışarı çıkmamıştın, o yüzden yönümü değiştirmeyi - hey!
es: Mira, me pareció ver que algo se movía por ahí, pero fue cuando iba a toda pastilla hacia la charca, porque te habías metido en el agua y no salías, y no iba a dar un rodeo para... Eh, ¿adonde vas?
es_results: "title": "El Señor de los Anillos", "author": "J.R.R. Tolkien"
vi_translation: “I think I saw something moving over there, but at that moment I was running towards the lake because you had jumped in and didn't come up, so I didn't turn back to... Hey!”
tr_translation: "I thought I saw something moving there, but at that moment I was running towards the pool because you had gone in and hadn't come out, so I was about to change my direction - hey!"
es_translation: Look, I thought I saw something moving over there, but it was when I was rushing towards the pond because you had gone into the water and weren't coming out, and I wasn't going to take a detour to...

yo: "Mo rò pé mo rí nkan kan tí ó ń lọ síbẹ̀ yẹn, ṣùgbọ́n mo sáré lọ sí odò adágún nígbà náà, nítorí pé o ti wọlé o kò sì tí ì wá sókè, nítorí náà mi ò ní ṣe ọ̀nà àbáyọ sí -- hey!"

en: "'And Death spoke to them. He was angry that he had been cheated out of the three new victims, for travelers usually drowned in the river. But Death was cunning. He pretended to congratulate the three brothers upon their magic, and said that each had earned a prize for having been clever enough to evade him.
en_results: "title": "The Three Billy Goats Gruff", "author": "Unknown (Traditional European Folk Tale)"
vi: “Và Thần Chết nói với họ. Thần rất tức giận là đã bị phỗng tay trên ba nạn nhân mới, bởi vì khách lữ hành thường sẽ chết đuối dưới dòng sông. Nhưng Thần Chết gian xảo lắm. Thần giả bộ chúc mừng ba anh em về pháp thuật của họ, và nói là mỗi người đáng được hưởng một phần thưởng cho sự khôn khéo lách được thần.
tr: "Ve Ölüm onlarla konuştu. Nehirin her zamanki boğulan yolcularının aksine, bu sefer üç yeni kurbanın onu kandırıp boğulmamasına çok kızmıştı. Fakat ölüm daha kurnazdı. Kardeşleri büyülerinden ötürü tebrik ediyormuş gibi davrandı ve onlara onu alt etme zekası gösterdikleri için her birinin bir ödülü hak ettiğini söyledi.
es: —«Y la Muerte les habló. Estaba contrariada porque acababa de perder a tres posibles víctimas, ya que normalmente los viajeros se ahogaban en el río. Pero ella fue muy astuta y, fingiendo felicitar a los tres hermanos por sus poderes mágicos, les dijo que cada uno tenía opción a un premio por haber sido lo bastante listo para eludirla.
es_results: "title": "El Laberinto del Fauno", "author": "William S. Burroughs"
vi_translation: “And Death spoke to them. He was very angry that he had been cheated out of three new victims, because travelers usually drowned in the river. But Death was cunning. He pretended to congratulate the three brothers on their magic, and said that each deserved a reward for having been clever enough to evade him.”
tr_translation: "And Death spoke to them. Unlike the river's usual drowning passengers, this time it was very angry that three new victims had tricked it and not drowned. But Death was more cunning. It pretended to congratulate the brothers for their magical feats and told them that each deserved a reward for having the wit to evade it."
es_translation: —"And Death spoke to them. She was upset because she had just lost three potential victims, as travelers usually drowned in the river. But she was very cunning and, pretending to congratulate the three brothers on their magical powers, told them that each had the option of a reward for being clever enough to evade her.

en: "'Then the second brother, who was an arrogant man, decided that he wanted to humiliate Death still further, and asked for the power to recall others from Death. So Death picked up a stone from the riverbank and gave it to the second brother, and told him that the stone would have the power to bring back the dead.
en_results: "title": "The Monkey King's Revenge", "author": "Wu Cheng'en"
vi: “Kế đến là người anh hai, một kẻ ngạo mạn, quyết định phải làm cho Thần Chết bẽ mặt hơn nữa, nên hỏi xin quyền lực gọi những người khác trở về từ cõi chết. Thần Chết bèn lượm một viên đá bên bờ sông và đưa cho người anh Hai, rồi nói với anh là viên đá đó có quyền năng gọi về những người chết.
tr: "Sonra, kibirli olan ortanca kardeş, Ölüm‘ü daha fazla aşağılamaya karar verdi ve diğerlerini Ölüm‘den döndürmek için güç istedi. Ölüm nehir kenarından bir taş aldı ve onu ortanca kardeşe verdi ve bu taşın ona, ölümü geri getirecek gücü vereceğini söyledi.
es: »A continuación, el hermano mediano, que era muy arrogante, quiso humillar aún más a la Muerte, y pidió que le concediera el poder de devolver la vida a los muertos. La Muerte cogió una piedra de la orilla del río y se la entregó, diciéndole que la piedra tendría el poder de resucitar a los difuntos.
es_results: "title": "El Libro de la Vida", "author": "Manuel Mujica Láinez"
vi_translation: "Next was the second brother, an arrogant man, who decided he must humiliate Death even further, so he asked for the power to summon others back from the dead." "Death then picked up a stone from the riverbank and gave it to the second brother, telling him that the stone had the power to bring back the dead."
tr_translation: "Then, the arrogant middle brother decided to further mock Death and asked for the power to bring others back from Death. Death took a stone from the riverbank and gave it to the middle brother, telling him that this stone would give him the power to bring back the dead."
es_translation: "Next, the middle brother, who was very arrogant, wanted to humiliate Death even more, and asked to be granted the power to bring the dead back to life." Death picked up a stone from the riverbank and handed it to him, telling him that the stone would have the power to resurrect the deceased.

en: "'That very night, another wizard crept upon the oldest brother as he lay, wine-sodden upon his bed. The thief took the wand and for good measure, slit the oldest brother's throat.
en_results: "title": "The Night Circus", "author": "Erin Morgenstern"
vi: “Chính ngay trong đêm đó, một phù thủy khác bò tới chỗ người anh cả khi anh nằm say bét nhè trên giường. Tên trộm ăn cắp cây đũa phép và để đảm bảo an toàn, hắn cắt luôn cổ họng người anh cả.
tr: "O gece, bir büyücü, şaraptan sızmış gibi yatan büyük kardeşin yanı başına gelir. Hırsız asayı değerli olduğunu düşünerek alır ve büyük kardeşin boğazını keser.
es: »Esa misma noche, otro mago se acercó con sigilo mientras el hermano mayor yacía, borracho como una cuba, en su cama, le robó la varita y, por si acaso, le cortó el cuello.
es_results: "title": "El laberinto de Espanglia", "author": "Miguel Ángel Asín y Gárate"
vi_translation: "That very night, another wizard crept up to the eldest brother as he lay there drunk in his bed. The thief stole the wand and, to ensure his safety, slit the eldest brother's throat.
tr_translation: "That night, a wizard comes to the side of the elder brother, who is lying as if passed out from wine. The thief takes the wand, thinking it is valuable, and slits the elder brother's throat."
es_translation: "That very night, another wizard crept up stealthily while the eldest brother lay, drunk as a skunk, in his bed, stole the wand, and, just to be sure, slit his throat."
st: Bosiung boo, wizard e 'ngoe e ile ea lla holim'a mor'abo rōna oa khale ka ho fetisisa ha a ntse a robetse, a hatakeloa ke veine holim'a bethe ea hae. Lesholu le ile la nka wand 'me ka tekanyo e ntle, lehlatsipa la mor'abo rōna oa khale.
yo: "Ní alẹ́ ọjọ́ náà gan-an, onímọ̀-ẹ̀gbọ́n mìíràn sọkún lórí ẹ̀gbọ́n ọkùnrin àgbà náà bí ó ṣe dùbúlẹ̀, tí ó tẹ ọtí wáìnì sórí ibùsùn rẹ̀. Olè náà mú ọ̀pá náà àti fún ìwọ̀n tó dára, gé ọ̀fun ẹ̀gbọ́n àgbà.
tn: 13Mme bosigo joo, moloi yo mongwe o ne a lela mo go mokaulengwe yo mogolo, fa a ntse a robetse, a wela mo bolaong jwa gagwe. Legodu le ne la tsaya le lentle, mme le ne le le mo tseleng e e siameng, le ne la ntsha mogodu wa gagwe yo mogolo.
ty: " 'I taua iho pô ra, ua ta'iri te tahi atu mata'i rorofa'i i te taea'e paari a tarava ai oia, ma te ta'iri i ni'a i to'na ro'i. Ua rave te taata eiâ i te tâpû raau e ua tâpû maitai oia i te arapoa o te taeae paari roa ' ' e.
mai: "ओही राति, एकटा आओर जादूगर सबसँ पैघ भाय पर पड़ल छल, ओकर बिछौना पर शराब-सोडेन। चोर छड़ी लऽ कऽ नीक मापक लेल सबसँ पैघ भायक गला काटि देलक।

en: "'Meanwhile, the second brother journeyed to his own home, where he lived alone. Here he took out the stone that had the power to recall the dead, and turned it thrice in his hand. To his amazement and his delight, the figure of the girl he had once hoped to marry, before her untimely death, appeared at once before him.
en_results: "title": "The Tale of Genji", "author": "Murasaki Shikibu"
vi: “Trong lúc đó người anh hai lên đường trở về nhà mình, nơi anh sống một mình. Tại đây anh lấy ra viên đá có quyền phép gọi về người chết và xoay nó ba lần trong tay. Anh ngạc nhiên và vui sướng biết bao khi hiện ra ngay tức thì trước mặt anh hình bóng người con gái anh đã từng hy vọng kết hôn trước khi nàng chết yểu.
tr: "Bu arada, ortanca kardeş, yalnız yaşadığı kendi evine doğru yolculuk etmektedir. Orada ölümü çağırmak için taşı eline alır, taşı üç kez elinde çevirir. Hayret ve sevinçle, bir zamanlar evlenmeyi umduğu, zamansız ölen kızın figürü bir kez daha ona görünür.
es: «Entretanto, el hermano mediano llegó a su casa, donde vivía solo. Una vez allí, cogió la piedra que tenía el poder de revivir a los muertos y la hizo girar tres veces en la mano. Para su asombro y placer, vio aparecer ante él la figura de la muchacha con quien se habría casado si ella no hubiera muerto prematuramente.
es_results: "title": "El laberinto de la esmeralda", "author": "Gabriel García Márquez"
vi_translation: “Meanwhile, the older brother set off on his journey back to his home, where he lived alone. There, he took out the stone that had the power to summon the dead and turned it three times in his hand. How amazed and delighted he was when the image of the girl he had once hoped to marry before she died young appeared instantly before him.
tr_translation: "Meanwhile, the middle brother is traveling towards his own house where he lives alone. There, he takes the stone to call upon death, and turns the stone thrice in his hand. With amazement and joy, the figure of the girl he once hoped to marry, who died untimely, appears to him once more."
es_translation: "Meanwhile, the middle brother arrived at his house, where he lived alone. Once there, he took the stone that had the power to revive the dead and spun it three times in his hand. To his amazement and pleasure, he saw the figure of the girl he would have married if she had not died prematurely appear before him.
st: "Ho sa le joalo, mor'abo rōna oa bobeli o ile a ea lapeng la hae, moo a neng a lula a le mong. O ile a nka lejoe le neng le e-na le matla a ho hopola bafu, 'me a le fetola ka letsohong la hae. Ho makala le thabo ea hae, setšoantšo sa ngoanana eo a neng a kile a ts'epa ho nyala, pele a shoa ka nako e sa lebelloang, o ile a hlaha hang pele ho eena.
yo: "Ní báyìí, arákùnrin kejì rin ìrìn àjò lọ sí ilé tirẹ̀, níbi tí òun nìkan ń gbé. Nibi o mu okuta ti o ni agbara lati ranti awọn okú, o si tan-an ni ọwọ rẹ. Sí ìyàlẹ́nu rẹ̀ àti ìdùnnú rẹ̀, ìrísí ọmọbìnrin tí ó ti lérò tẹ́lẹ̀ láti ṣe ìgbéyàwó, kí ó tó kú láì àkókò, farahàn lẹ́ẹ̀kan ṣoṣo níwájú rẹ̀.
tn: 'Kgaitsadie wa bobedi o ne a ya kwa ga gabo, kwa a neng a nna a le nosi teng. O ne a tsaya letlapa le le neng le na le maatla a go gakologelwa baswi, a le fetola mo seatleng sa gagwe. Ka ntlha ya go gakgamala ga gagwe le boitumelo jwa gagwe, palo ya mosetsana yo a neng a kile a solofetse go nyala, pele ga loso lwa gagwe lo lo sa nyalanang, lo ne lwa bonala ka bonako pele ga gagwe.
ty: " 'I taua taime ra, ua tere atu te piti o te taea'e i to'na iho fare, i reira oia ana'e e ora ai. I reira, rave maira oia i te ofa'i tei mau i te mana no te haamana'o i tei pohe, e ua tuu atura i roto i to'na rima. I to ' na maere e to ' na oaoa, ua fa oioi mai te hoho'a o te tamahine o ta ' na i mana'o na e faaipoipo, hou to ' na poheraa oioi, i mua ia ' na.
mai: "एम्हर दोसर भाय अपन घर चलि गेल, जतय ओ असगर रहैत छल। एतय ओ ओ पाथर निकाललनि जाहिमे मृतककेँ स्मरण करबाक शक्ति छल, आ ओकरा अपन हाथमे तीन बेर घुमा देलनि। हुनका आश्चर्य आ प्रसन्नताक कारण, जाहि लड़कीसँ ओ कहियो विवाह करबाक आशा कयने छलाह, ओकर असामयिक मृत्युसँ पहिने, ओकर आकृति एकहि बेर हुनक समक्ष प्रकट भऽ गेल।
