en: “But that's – I'm sorry, but that's completely ridiculous! How can I possibly prove it doesn't exist? Do you expect me to get hold of – of all the pebbles in the world and test them? I mean, you could claim that anything's real if the only basis for believing in it is that nobody's proved it doesn't exist!”
en_results: "title": "The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy", "author": "Douglas Adams"
vi: “Nhưng chuyện đó… Cháu xin lỗi, nhưng chuyện đó hết sức khôi hài! Làm sao cháu có thể chứng minh nó không có thật chứ? Chẳng nhẽ bác muốn cháu đi lượm hết… hết tất cả những viên sỏi trên thế gian mà đem ra thử nghiệm? Ý cháu là, bác có thể tuyên bố bất kỳ cái gì là có thật nếu cơ sở duy nhất để tin vào điều đó chỉ là không ai chứng minh được điều đó không hề có thật sao!”
tr: "Fakat bu- üzgünüm, ama bu tamamen saçmalık! Bunun var olmadığını nasıl kanıtlayabilirim? Dünyadaki tüm çakıl taşlarını alıp test etmemi beklemiyorsunuz ya? Demek istediğim, hiç kimse olmadığını ispatlamadığı sürece herhangi birşeyin gerçek olabileceğini mi düşünüyorsunuz?
es: —¡Pero...! ¡Perdone, pero esto es completamente ridícu-lo! —explotó Hermione, indignada—. ¿Cómo voy a demostrar que no existe? ¿Pretende que examine todos los guijarros del planeta y lo compruebe? Con ese enfoque, usted podría afirmar que cualquier cosa es real basándose únicamente en que nadie ha demostrado lo contrario.
es_results: "title": "Harry Potter y el Prisionero de Azkaban", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi_translation: “But that... I'm sorry, but that's absolutely ridiculous! How can I prove that it doesn't exist? Do you want me to pick up... pick up every single pebble in the world to test it? I mean, you could claim anything is real if the only basis for believing it is that no one has proven it doesn't exist!”
tr_translation: "But this- I'm sorry, but this is complete nonsense! How can I prove that it doesn't exist? You don't expect me to take all the pebbles in the world and test them, do you? I mean, do you think anything can be real as long as no one has proven it doesn't exist?"
es_translation: Excuse me, but this is completely ridiculous! —exploded Hermione, indignant—. How am I supposed to prove that it doesn't exist? Do you expect me to examine every pebble on the planet and verify it? With that approach, you could claim that anything is real based solely on the fact that no one has proven otherwise.

vi: Hắn vung mạnh hai tay ra xa. Cánh cổng tự vặn vẹo uốn éo, từ những đường cong chỗ cuốn trừu tượng biến ra một bộ mặt dễ sợ, cái mặt đó nói bằng một giọng leng keng ngân nga: “Nói rõ mục đích!”
tr: Korkuyla ellerini hızlı bir şekilde geri çekti. Demir, sarmallarından ve halkalarından kendisini ayırarak kıvrım kıvrım bükülüp şakırdayarak, yankılanan bir sesle konuşan korkunç bir yüze dönüştü, "Maksadını belirt!"
es: Apartó las manos con rapidez, asustado, pues el hierro empezó a contorsionarse y retorcerse, y sus intrincadas curvas y espirales compusieron un rostro horrendo que habló con una voz resonante y metálica: —¡Manifiesta tus intenciones!

vi_translation: And then, after a slight shudder, the house-elf lay still, and its eyes were now just two large, lifeless glass orbs, reflecting the light from the stars that it could no longer see.
tr_translation: And with a small tremor, the house-elf became motionless, and those big eyes were nothing more than glass orbs now.
es_translation: Dobby shuddered a little and remained still, and his eyes turned into two enormous and glassy spheres speckled with the glow of the stars they could no longer see.

en: It was like planning to break into the Ministry all over again. They settled to work in the smallest bedroom, which was kept, according to Griphook's preference, in semidarkness.
en_results: "title": "Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi: Như thể lại một phen nữa lên kế hoạch đột nhập Bộ Pháp Thuật. Tụi nó lấy căn phòng nhỏ nhất đó để làm nơi bàn bạc, và theo ý thích của Griphook, căn phòng được giữ trong cảnh tranh tối, tranh sáng.
vi_results: "title": "Harry Potter và Phòng Bóng Ma", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
tr: Bakanlık'a giriş planını baştan sonra tekrar yapmak gibiydi. Çalışmak için, Griphook‘un tercihine göre yarı karanlıkta tutulan en küçük yatak odasına yerleştiler.
es: Fue como planear otra vez la entrada en el ministerio. Se pusieron a trabajar en el mismo dormitorio, quedándose en penumbra porque el duende así lo prefería.
es_results: "title": "El Ministerio del Terror", "author": "Miguel Ángel Asín y del Palacio"
vi_translation: It was as if they were planning another break-in at the Ministry of Magic. They took the smallest room as their meeting place, and at Griphook's request, the room was kept in semi-darkness.
tr_translation: It was like redoing the plan to enter the Ministry from start to finish. To work, they settled in the smallest bedroom, which was kept semi-dark according to Griphook's preference.
es_translation: It was like planning the entry into the ministry all over again. They started working in the same bedroom, staying in the dim light because the goblin preferred it that way.

en: "It destroyed her, what they did: She was never right again. She wouldn't use magic, but she couldn't get rid of it; it turned inward and drove her mad, it exploded out of her when she couldn't control it, and at times she was strange and dangerous. But mostly she was sweet and scared and harmless.
en_results: "title": "The Dark-Hunter series", "author": "Sherrilyn Kenyon"
vi: “Việc đó đã hủy hoại con nhỏ: nó không bao giờ hoàn toàn bình phục lại được. Nó không dùng được pháp thuật nữa nhưng lại không thoát khỏi được pháp thuật; năng lực pháp thuật chuyển vào bên trong khiến nó phát khùng, khi nó không kiềm chế được thì năng lực pháp thuật bùng phát ra ngoài, những lúc đó nó thành kỳ quái và nguy hiểm. Còn thường thì con nhỏ dễ thương và nhút nhát vô hại.”

es: —Lo que le hicieron esos chicos la dejó destrozada y nunca volvió a ser la misma. Ariana no quería emplear la magia, pero tampoco podía librarse de ella, y la magia se le quedó dentro y la enloqueció; explotaba cuando ella no conseguía controlarla, y a veces hacía cosas extrañas y peligrosas. Pero en general era una niña cariñosa e inofensiva, y estaba muy asustada.
es_results: "title": "Harry Potter y la piedra filosofal", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi_translation: “That incident ruined the child: she never fully recovered. She could no longer use magic, but she couldn't escape from it either; the magical energy turned inward, driving her mad. When she couldn't control it, the magic would burst out, making her strange and dangerous. But most of the time, she was a sweet and shy harmless girl.”
tr_translation: "It destroyed him, what they did: He never recovered. He didn't use magic, but he never fully got rid of it, it went out of his control and drove him crazy, it exploded when he couldn't control it, and sometimes it was quite strange and dangerous. But most of the time he was sweet, scared, and harmless.
es_translation: —What those boys did to her left her shattered, and she was never the same again. Ariana didn't want to use magic, but she couldn't get rid of it either, and the magic stayed inside her and drove her crazy; it would explode when she couldn't control it, and sometimes it did strange and dangerous things. But generally, she was a loving and harmless child, and she was very scared.

en: There was a great roar and a surge toward the stairs, he was pressed back against he wall as they ran past hi, the mingled members of the Order of the Phoenix, Dumbledore's Army, and Harry's old Quidditch team, all with their wands drawn, heading up into the main castle.
en_results: "title": "Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi: Một tiếng hô rân trời và mọi người ùn ùn kéo lên cầu thang, Harry bị ép vô sát tường khi những người khác chạy ngang qua nó, thành viên Hội Phượng Hoàng lẫn lộn với Đoàn quân Dumbledore, và đội Quidditch trước đây của Harry, tất cả đều cầm sẵn đũa phép hướng về phía tòa lâu đài chính.
vi_results: "title": "Harry Potter và Phòng Tù của Phượng Hoàng", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
tr: Büyük bir gürültü koptu ve merdivenin ucuna doğru bir dalgalanma, karışmış Zümrüdüanka Yoldaşlığı‘nın üyeleri, Dumbledore‘un Ordusu ve Harry‘nin eski Quidditch takımı, hepsi asaları yukarda, şato yönüne koşup onun yanından geçerken o, arkada duvara doğru sıkıştırılmıştı.
es: Hubo un gran clamor y todo el mundo se precipitó hacia el pie de la escalera. Harry tuvo que pegarse a la pared para dejarlos pasar. Era una mezcla de miembros de la Orden del Fénix, del Ejército de Dumbledore y del antiguo equipo de quidditch de Harry, todos varita en mano, dirigiéndose hacia la parte central del castillo.
es_results: "title": "Harry Potter y el Prisionero de Azkaban", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi_translation: A thunderous shout and everyone surged up the stairs, Harry was pressed against the wall as others ran past him, members of the Order of the Phoenix mingling with Dumbledore's Army, and Harry's former Quidditch team, all with wands ready, heading towards the main castle.
tr_translation: A loud noise erupted and a wave of mixed members of the Order of the Phoenix, Dumbledore's Army, and Harry's old Quidditch team, all with their wands raised, ran towards the castle, passing by him as he was pressed against the wall at the back.
es_translation: There was a great clamor and everyone rushed towards the foot of the stairs. Harry had to press himself against the wall to let them pass. It was a mix of members of the Order of the Phoenix, Dumbledore's Army, and Harry's old Quidditch team, all with wands in hand, heading towards the center of the castle.

es: En ese momento se oyeron pasos y luego un fuerte golpazo: alguien más acababa de salir por el túnel, pero había perdido el equilibrio y se había caído. El recién llegado se levantó agarrándose a la primera butaca que encontró, miró alrededor a través de unas torcidas gafas de montura de concha y farfulló: —¿Llego tarde? ¿Ha empezado ya? es_translation: At that moment, footsteps were heard followed by a loud thud: someone else had just come out of the tunnel, but had lost their balance and fallen. en: But her final words were drowned as a different voice echoed throughout the Hall. It was high, cold, and clear. There was no telling from where it came. It seemed to issue from the walls themselves. Like the monster it had once commanded, it might have lain dormant there for centuries.
en_results: "title": "The Shining", "author": "Stephen King"
vi: Nhưng những lời nó cuối câu của cô đã bị nhấn chìm bằng một giọng nói khác vang vọng khắp Đại Sảnh Đường. Giọng đó cao, lạnh, và rõ ràng. Không thể biết được giọng nói đó phát ra từ đâu. Có vẻ như nó phát ra từ chính những bức tường. Như thế nó đã nằm ngủ trong đó nhiều thế kỉ, giống như con quái vật mà nó từng điều khiển.
tr: Ama son kelimeleri salon boyunca başka bir ses yankılanırken boğuldu. Yüksek, soğuk ve açıktı: Nereden geldiğine dair bir şey söylenmemişti; Duvarlardan çıkıyor gibiydi. Bir zamanlar emir verdiği yaratık gibi, orada yüzyıllardır uykuya yatmış olabilirdi.
es: Pero el final de la frase quedó ahogado por otra voz que resonó en todo el comedor. Era una voz aguda, fría y clara, y parecía provenir de las mismas paredes. Se diría que llevaba siglos ahí, latente, como el monstruo al que una vez ha-bía mandado.
es_results: "title": "El laberinto del fauno", "author": "Gabriel García Márquez"
vi_translation: But her last words were drowned out by another voice echoing throughout the Great Hall. That voice was high, cold, and clear. It was impossible to tell where the voice was coming from. It seemed to emanate from the very walls themselves. As if it had been sleeping there for centuries, like the monster it once controlled.
tr_translation: But her last words were drowned out by another voice echoing across the room. It was high, cold, and clear: Nothing was said about where it came from; it seemed to be emanating from the walls. Like the creature she once commanded, it could have been lying dormant there for centuries.
es_translation: But the end of the sentence was drowned out by another voice that echoed throughout the dining room. It was a sharp, cold, and clear voice, and it seemed to come from the very walls. One might say it had been there for centuries, latent, like the monster it had once commanded.
st: Empa mantsoe a hae a ho qetela a ile a hlatsuoa e le lentsoe le fapaneng le isitsoeng ho pholletsa le Holo. E ne e le e phahameng, e batang ebile e hlakile. Ha a ka a mpolella hore na e tsoa kae. Ho ne ho bonahala eka ho tloha marakong ka boeona. Joalo ka phoofolo ea tonanahali eo e kileng ea e laela, e kanna eaba e robala moo ka makholo a lilemo.

en: He had not meant to shout, but anger and panic were threatening to overwhelm him. He glanced at his watch as she hovered in front of him. It was a quarter to midnight.
en_results: "title": "Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi: Nó không có ý quát, nhưng cơn giận và hoảng loạn đang có nguy cơ áp đảo nó. Nó liếc nhìn đồng hồ đeo tay trong khi con ma lờ lững trước mặt nó. Còn mười lăm phút nữa đến nửa đêm.

es: Harry no quería gritar, pero la rabia y el pánico amenazaban con apoderarse de él. Consultó su reloj mientras el fantasma permanecía suspendido ante él: eran las doce menos cuarto.

vi_translation: It didn't mean to shout, but the anger and panic were threatening to overwhelm it. It glanced at its wristwatch while the ghost floated lazily in front of it. Fifteen minutes left until midnight.

en: He closed his eyes on her command, and at once, the screams and bangs and all the discordant sounds of the battle were drowned until they became distant, as though he stood far, far away from them... Nó nhắm mắt lại theo lệnh của Hermione, và ngay lập tức, tiếng gào rú tiếng nổ đùng đoàng cùng tất cả âm thanh chói lói của chiến trường bị chìm lắng cho đến khi chúng trở nên xa xôi, như thể nó đang đứng ở xa, rất xa chúng… Hắn đang đứng ở một căn phòng bỏ hoang quen thuộc một cách kì lạ, những bức tường tróc lở giấy dán tường và tất cả cửa sổ, trừ một cái, đều bị đóng bít bằng ván.

Duvarlarda soyulmuş duvar kağıtlarının olduğu ve bir tanesinin dışında bütün camların tahtayla kapatılmış olduğu virane ama tanıdık bir odanın ortasında duruyordu.
es: Cerró los ojos obedeciendo a Hermione, y al instante los gritos, los estallidos y todos los estridentes sonidos de la batalla fueron disminuyendo hasta quedar reducidos a un lejano rumor, como si él estuviera lejos, muy lejos de allí... Se hallaba en medio de una habitación que, pese a la atmósfera tétrica que destilaba, le resultaba extrañamente familiar.
es_results: "title": "Harry Potter y la piedra filosofal", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi_translation: It closed its eyes following Hermione's command, and immediately, the screams, the explosions, and all the piercing sounds of the battlefield faded until they became distant, as if it were standing far, far away from them... He was standing in a strangely familiar abandoned room, with wallpaper peeling off the walls and all the windows, except one, boarded up.
tr_translation: At his command, he closed his eyes and suddenly the screams and explosions and all the discordant sounds of the battle were drowned out, until they were distant, as if he were far away, very far away from them... He was standing in the middle of a dilapidated but familiar room, where the walls had peeling wallpaper and all the windows except one were boarded up.
es_translation: He closed his eyes obeying Hermione, and instantly the screams, explosions, and all the shrill sounds of the battle began to fade until they were reduced to a distant murmur, as if he were far, far away from there... He found himself in the middle of a room that, despite the eerie atmosphere it exuded, felt strangely familiar to him.

en: The castle was unnaturally silent. There were no flashes of light now, no bangs or screams or shouts. The flagstones of the deserted entrance hall were stained with blood. Emeralds were still scattered all over the floor, along with pieces of marble and splintered wood. Part of the banisters had been blown away.
en_results: "title": "The Eye of the World", "author": "Robert Jordan"
vi: Tòa lâu đài im lìm một cách quái đản. Bây giờ không còn những tia sáng nháng lên nữa, không còn tiếng nổ đùng đoàng nữa, cũng không còn tiếng gào hay tiếng thét. Những phiến đá lát nền của Tiền sảnh hoang vắng vẫn còn vấy máu. Những viên ngọc bích vẫn còn vương vãi khắp sàn, cùng với những mảnh cẩm thạch bể và những mẩu gỗ vụn. Một phần của cái bao lơn đã bị nổ văng mất tiêu.
tr: Şato garip bir şekilde sessizdi. Artık çakan ışıklar, patlamalar, çığlıklar ya da bağırışlar yoktu. Terkedilmiş Giriş Salonu'nda bayraklar kana bulanmıştı. Zümrütler, yerdeki mermer parçaları ve odun kıymıkları arasına saçılmıştı. Tırabzanların bir bölümü havaya uçmuştu.
es: En el castillo reinaba un silencio nada natural y ya no había destellos de luz, ni estallidos, gritos o alaridos. Las losas del desierto vestíbulo estaban manchadas de sangre; todavía había esmeraldas diseminadas por el suelo, junto con trozos de mármol y maderas astilladas, y parte de la barandilla se había destrozado.
es_results: "title": "El laberinto del fauno", "author": "Willy de Molina (seudónimo de Guillermo del Toro y otros autores)"
vi_translation: The castle was eerily silent. There were no more flashes of light, no more explosions, no more screams or shouts. The flagstones of the deserted Great Hall were still stained with blood. Emeralds were still scattered across the floor, along with shards of broken marble and splinters of wood. A part of the balcony had been blown away.
tr_translation: The castle was eerily silent. There were no more flashing lights, explosions, screams, or shouts. In the Abandoned Entrance Hall, the flags were stained with blood. Emeralds were scattered among the marble fragments and wood splinters on the ground. A section of the railings had been blown up.
es_translation: In the castle reigned an unnatural silence and there were no longer flashes of light, nor explosions, screams, or howls. The slabs of the deserted vestibule were stained with blood; there were still emeralds scattered on the floor, along with pieces of marble and splintered wood, and part of the railing had been shattered.
st: Ntlo ena e ne e khutsitse ka mokhoa o sa lebelloang. Ho ne ho se na leseli la leseli hona joale, ha ho na li-bangs kapa li-screams kapa li-screams. Ho ne ho e-na le likarolo tse ling tsa li-banisters tse neng li le sieo.

en: But the girl had let go of the swing at the very height of its arc and flown into the air, quite literally flown, launched herself skyward with a great shout of laughter, and instead of crumpling on the playground asphalt, she soared like a trapeze artist through the air, staying up far too long, landing far too lightly.
en_results: "title": "A Visit from the Goon Squad", "author": "Jennifer Egan"
vi: Nhưng cô bé đã thả cái đu ra khi đu lên tới đỉnh của vòng cung và bay vào không khí, bay theo nghĩa đen hoàn toàn, tự phóng mình lên trời và ré lên cười thật to, và thay vì té nhào lên nền sân chơi tráng nhựa, cô bé bay vút lên như nghệ sĩ nhào lộn trên không, lượn ở trên cao quá lâu và đáp xuống đất quá ư nhẹ nhàng.
tr: Ancak kız salıncağın en yüksek anında kendini havaya bıraktı, havaya yükseldi, kelimesi kelimesine havaya yükseldi, gülmekten kırılarak kendini havaya fırlattı ve oyun alanının asfaltına yapışmak yerine bir trapezci gibi havada süzüldü, fazladan uzun bir süre havada kaldı ve yumuşak bir şekilde sonunda yere indi.
es: Pero la pequeña se había soltado del columpio al llegar al punto más alto y voló literalmente por los aires: se impulsó hacia arriba, dando una gran risotada, y en lugar de caer en el asfalto del parque se elevó como una trapecista y permaneció largo rato suspendida. Cuando por fin se posó en el suelo, lo hizo con asombrosa suavidad.
es_results: "title": "La Sombra del Ciprés", "author": "Carlos Ruiz Zafón"
vi_translation: But the little girl let go of the swing when it reached the top of its arc and flew into the air, literally flying, launching herself into the sky and laughing loudly, and instead of crashing onto the asphalt playground, she soared like an aerial acrobat, hovered in the air for an unusually long time, and landed on the ground very gently.
tr_translation: However, at the highest point of the swing, the girl let herself go, soared into the air, literally soared into the air, launched herself into the air while laughing uncontrollably, and instead of crashing onto the asphalt of the playground, she glided through the air like a trapeze artist, stayed in the air for an unusually long time, and finally landed softly on the ground.
es_translation: But the little girl had let go of the swing at its highest point and literally flew through the air: she propelled herself upwards, letting out a big laugh, and instead of falling onto the park's asphalt, she rose like a trapeze artist and remained suspended for a long time. When she finally landed on the ground, she did so with astonishing softness.
st: Empa ngoanana o ne a lumelletse ho ea ka lebelo le phahameng haholo la arc ea eona 'me a fofisoa moeeng, haholo-holo a fofa, o ile a qala ka mohoo o moholo oa ho tšeha, 'me ho e-na le ho crumpling lebaleng la lipapali asphalt, o ile a tiisa joalo ka sebini se trapeze ka moea, a lula a le hole haholo, ho lula hole haholo.

en: He moved down the steps and out into the darkness. It was nearly four in the morning, and the deathly stillness of the grounds felt as though they were holding their breath, waiting to see whether he could do what he must.
en_results: "title": "The Shining", "author": "Stephen King"
vi: Nó đi xuống những bậc thềm và tiến vào bóng tối. Gần bốn giờ sáng rồi, và nỗi tĩnh lặng chết chóc của sân trường khiến sân trường có vẻ như đang nín thở chờ xem liệu nó có thể làm được điều nó phải làm.
tr: Harry basamaklardan aşağı indi ve karanlığa karıştı. Yaklaşık sabahın dördüydü, ve bahçedeki ölümcül sessizlik Harry'ye sanki herkes nefesini tutuyormuş, ve onun yapması gerektiği şeyi yapıp yapmayacağını görmek için bekliyorlarmış gibi hissettiriyordu.
es: Bajó los escalones. Eran casi las cuatro de la madrugada. Los oscuros jardines estaban sumidos en un silencio sepulcral; parecía como si contuvieran la respiración, a la espera de comprobar si Harry sería capaz de cumplir su cometido.
es_results: "title": "Harry Potter y la piedra filosofal", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi_translation: It went down the steps and into the darkness. It was almost four in the morning, and the deadly silence of the schoolyard made it seem as if the yard was holding its breath, waiting to see if it could do what it had to do.
tr_translation: Harry went down the steps and disappeared into the darkness. It was around four in the morning, and the deadly silence in the garden made Harry feel as if everyone was holding their breath, waiting to see if he would do what he needed to do.
es_translation: He descended the steps. It was almost four in the morning. The dark gardens were shrouded in a sepulchral silence; it seemed as if they were holding their breath, waiting to see if Harry would be able to accomplish his task.
st: 'Me o ile a fallela lefifing, 'me o ile a ea lefifing. E ne e le nako e ka bang 'nè hoseng, 'me khutso ea mabaka a shoang a ikutloa eka ba ne ba tšoere phefumoloho ea bona, ba emetse ho bona hore na a ka etsa seo a lokelang ho se etsa.
yo: Ó gbé àwọn ìgbésẹ̀ náà sọ̀kalẹ̀ ó sì jáde sínú òkùnkùn. Ó fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ tó mẹ́rin òwúrọ̀, àti pé ìdádúró ikú ilẹ̀ náà dàbí ẹni pé wọ́n ń mí, tí wọ́n ń dúró láti rí bóyá ó lè ṣe ohun tí ó gbọ́dọ̀ ṣe.
tn: O ne a fudusa dikgato a bo a tsamaya mo lefifing. E ne e le 4 mo mosong, mme khutso ya mabaka a a suleng a ne a ikutlwa jaaka e kete ba ne ba hema, ba letile go bona gore a a ka kgona go dira se a tshwanetseng go se dira.

en: A swarm of dementors was gliding amongst the trees; he could feel their chill, and he was not sure he would be able to pass safely through it. He had not strength left for a Patronus. He could no longer control his own trembling. It was not, after all, so easy to die. Every second he breathed, the smell of the grass, the cool air on his face, was so precious: To think that people had years and years, time to waste, so much time it dragged, and he was clinging to each second. At the same time he thought that he would not be able to go on, and knew that he must. The long game was ended, the Snitch had been caught, it was time to leave the air. . . .
en_results: "title": "Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi: Một bầy Giám ngục đang lướt giữa rừng cây, nó có thể cảm nhận được cơn lạnh buốt toát ra từ chúng, và nó chắc chắn nó có thể an toàn đi qua. Nó không còn sức để gọi Thần Hộ Mệnh. Nó không kìm chế được cơn run của chính nó nữa. Nói cho cùng, chết đâu có dễ. Mỗi giây nó thở, mùi cỏ, làn không khí mát lạnh vuốt ve gương mặt nó, sao mà quý giá: cứ nghĩ người ta có hàng bao nhiêu năm và tháng, và thời gian để lãng phí, quá nhiều thì giờ để lê la, mà nó thì đang bám víu lấy từng giây một. Cùng một lúc nó vừa nghĩ nó không thể nào đi nổi nữa, nó vừa biết rằng nó phải đi. Trò chơi dài đã kết thúc, trái banh Snitch đã được bắt, đã đến lúc phải rời không trung… Trái banh Snitch.
vi_results: "title": "Harry Potter và Trái Phục Sinh", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
tr: Bir Ruh Emici sürüsü ağaçların arasından süzülüyordu; Harry onların yaydığı soğuğu hissedebiliyordu, ve onların arasından güvenli bir şekilde geçebileceğinden emin değildi. Bir Patronus yaratmak için gücü kalmamıştı. Harry titremesine daha fazla engel olamadı. Bu kadar şeyden sonra ölmek bu kadar kolay olmamalıydı. Nefes aldığı her saniye, çimenin kokusu, yüzüne çarpan serin hava, onun için çok kıymetliydi: İnsanların yılları ve yılları olduğunu, boşa harcamak, geride bırakmak için birçok zamanlarının olduğunu, ama şu an kendisinin her saniyeye sıkı sıkı tutunmak zorunda olduğunu düşünmek. Aynı anda Harry devam edemeyeceğini de düşünüyor ama etmesi gerektiğini de biliyordu. Uzun soluklu oyun sona ermişti, Snitch yakalanmıştı, göğü terk etmenin tam zamanıydı... Snitch.
es: Un enjambre de dementores se deslizaba entre los árboles. Harry sintió propagarse su frío y dudó que lograra combatirlo. No le quedaban fuerzas para hacer aparecer un patronus, ni controlaba ya sus temblores. Al fin y al cabo, morir no era tan fácil. Cada inspiración que daba, el olor a hierba, la fresca brisa en la cara... todo adquiría un gran valor. Y pensar que la gente disponía de años y años de vida, tiempo de sobra, tanto que a veces hasta resultaba una carga; y él, en cambio, se aferraba a cada segundo que transcurría. No se sentía capaz de continuar, pero sabía que debía hacerlo. Aquel largo juego había terminado, ha-bían atrapado la snitch, había llegado el momento de descender... La snitch.
es_results: "title": "Harry Potter y el prisionero de Azkaban", "author": "J.K. Rowling"
vi_translation: A group of Dementors was gliding through the trees; it could feel the chilling cold emanating from them, and it was sure it could safely pass through. It no longer had the strength to summon a Patronus. It could no longer control its own shivering. After all, dying wasn't easy. Every second it breathed, the smell of grass, the cool air caressing its face, felt so precious: to think people had so many years and months, and time to waste, so much time to dawdle, while it was clinging to every single second. At the same time, it thought it couldn't go on, it knew it had to go. The long game was over, the Snitch had been caught, it was time to leave the air... The Snitch ball.
tr_translation: A swarm of Dementors was gliding through the trees; Harry could feel the cold they emitted, and he wasn't sure if he could pass through them safely. He no longer had the strength to create a Patronus. Harry could no longer stop himself from trembling. After all this, dying shouldn't be this easy. Every second he breathed, the smell of the grass, the cool air hitting his face, was precious to him: Thinking that people had years and years, so much time to waste, to leave behind, but now he had to cling tightly to every second. At the same time, Harry thought he couldn't go on but knew he had to. The long game was over, the Snitch had been caught, it was time to leave the sky... Snitch.
es_translation: A swarm of dementors was gliding between the trees. Harry felt their cold spreading and doubted he could fight it off. He had no strength left to conjure a Patronus, nor could he control his trembling anymore. After all, dying wasn't that easy. Every breath he took, the smell of grass, the cool breeze on his face... everything took on great value. And to think that people had years and years of life, plenty of time, so much that sometimes it even became a burden; and he, on the other hand, clung to every passing second. He didn't feel capable of continuing, but he knew he had to. That long game had ended, they had caught the snitch, it was time to descend... The snitch.
st: Ho ne ho e-na le hoo, ho ne ho e-na le li-mushroom tse nang le lihlahla tse ling; O ne a ka utloa bohloko ba hae, 'me ha a na bonnete ba hore o tla khona ho feta ka tsela e sireletsehileng. Ha aa ka a ba le matla a ho ba le motšehetsi. A ke ke a hlola a laola thothomelo ya hae. Ka mor'a moo, ho ne ho se bonolo ho shoa. O ile a phefumoloha, monko oa joang, moea o pholileng sefahlehong sa hae, o ne o le bohlokoa haholo: Ho nahana hore batho ba ne ba e-na le lilemo le lilemo, nako ea ho senya, nako e ngata e hulela, 'me o ne a khomarela motsotsoana o mong le o mong. Ka nako e ts'oanang o ne a nahana hore a ke ke a hlola a tsoela pele, mme o ne a tseba hore o tlameha. Papali e telele e felile, Snitch e ne e ts'oaroa, e ne e le nako ea ho tloha moeeng. ...
yo: A swarm ti dementors ti a gliding laarin awọn igi; Ó lè ní ìmọ̀lára òtútù wọn, kò sì dá a lójú pé yóò lè kọjá láìléwu nípasẹ̀ rẹ̀. Kò ní agbára tó kù fún Patronus. Kò lè ṣàkóso ìwárìrì tirẹ̀ mọ́. Kò, lẹ́yìn gbogbo rẹ̀, ó rọrùn púpọ̀ láti kú. Ní gbogbo ìṣẹ́jú àáyá ó mí, òórùn koríko, afẹ́fẹ́ tó tutù lójú rẹ̀, ṣeyebíye púpọ̀: Láti rò pé àwọn ènìyàn ní ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọdún àti ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ọdún, àkókò láti ṣòfò, ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àkókò tí ó fà, ó sì ń faramọ́ ìṣẹ́jú àáyá kọ̀ọ̀kan. Ní àsìkò kan náà ó rò pé òun kò ní lè tẹ̀síwájú, ó sì mọ̀ pé òun gbọ́dọ̀ ṣe é. Eré gígùn náà parí, wọ́n ti mú Snitch, àsìkò ti tó láti kúrò ní afẹ́fẹ́. . . .
tn: Ba ne ba na le ditshika tse di neng di le mo gare ga ditlhare tse di neng di le mo gare ga ditlhare. O ne a ka nna a ikutlwa a le mo kotsing, mme a sa itse gore o tla kgona go tsamaya ka pabalesego. O ne a se na maatla a go nna le monna yo o nonofileng. O ne a sa kgone go laola letshogo la gagwe. Ka ntlha ya seo, go ne go se motlhofo go swa. O ne a hema, monko wa bojang, moya o o tsidifetseng mo sefatlhegong sa gagwe, o ne o le botlhokwa jaana: Go akanya gore batho ba na le dingwaga le dingwaga, nako ya go senya, e le nako e ntsi e e gogelang, mme o ne a kgomarela mongwe le mongwe wa bobedi. O ne a akanya gore ga a kitla a kgona go tswelela, mme o ne a itse gore o tshwanetse go dira jalo. 'The game was been caught, it was a time to leave the air' - Motshamekô o ne o le moleele o o neng o tshwerwe, e ne e le nako ya go tswa mo loaping
ty: Te nee haere ra te hoê pŭpŭ taata iino i rotopu i te mau tumu raau ; e nehenehe ta'na e ite i to ratou ri'ari'a, e aita oia i papû e, e nehenehe anei ta'na e haere ma te pe'ape'a ore na roto i te reira. Aita to'na e puai faahou no te rave i te reira. Eita ta ' na e nehenehe faahou e haavî i to ' na iho ruru. Inaha, e ere roa ' tu i te mea ohie ia pohe. I te mau tetoni atoa e huti oia i te aho, e mea hau'a roa te hau'a o te aihere, te mata'i to'eto'e i ni'a i to'na hoho'a mata : Ia feruri ana'e oia e, e rave rahi matahiti e te matahiti to te taata, e taime rahi to'na no te haamâu'a i te reira, e te tape'a maite ra oia i te tetoni tata'itahi. I taua taime atoa ra, ua mana'o oia e, eita e ti'a ia'na ia haere i mua, e ua ite oia e, e mea ti'a ia'na ia na reira. Ua hope te ha'utiraa roa, ua haruhia te Snitch, ua tae i te taime no te faaru'e i te reva...
mai: डिमेंटरक एकटा झुण्ड गाछक बीच चलि रहल छल; ओ ओकर ठंढा अनुभव कऽ सकैत छलाह, आ ओ सुनिश्चित नहि छलाह जे ओ ओहिसँ सुरक्षित रूपसँ गुजरि सकैत छथि। संरक्षक लेल हुनक शक्ति नहि बचल छलनि। ओ आब अपन कांप के नियंत्रित नहि कए सकैत छलखिन। आखिरकार, मरनाइ एतेक आसान नहि छल। प्रत्येक सेकेण्ड ओ साँस लेलनि, घासक गंध, हुनक मुँह पर शीतल हवा, एतेक अनमोल छल: ई सोचब जे लोकक लग साल-साल, बर्बाद करबाक समय, एतेक समय घसीटैत छल, आ ओ एक-दोसरासँ चिपकि रहल छलाह। संगहि ओ सोचलनि जे ओ आगू नहि बढ़ि सकैत छथि, आ जनैत छलाह जे हुनका जरूर चलबाक चाही। लम्बा खेल समाप्त भऽ गेल छल, स्निच पकड़ल गेल छल, हवा छोड़बाक समय छल। . . .

Tsy nanana hery tavela ho an'ny Patronus izy. Tsy nahafehy ny fangoraham-pony intsony izy. Tsy mora ny maty, raha ny marina. Isan-tsegondra dia niaina izy, tena sarobidy ny fofon'ny bozaka, ny rivotra mangatsiaka teo amin'ny tarehiny: Ny fiheverana fa nanana taona sy taona maro ny olona, fotoana fandaniam-potoana, fotoana betsaka nisintonana izany, ary nifikitra tamin'ny segondra tsirairay izy. Nihevitra koa izy fa tsy ho afaka hanohy intsony, ary fantany fa tsy maintsy manao izany izy. Tapitra ny lalao lava, tratra ny Snitch, fotoana izao hialana amin'ny rivotra.

en: He lay facedown, listening to the silence. He was perfectly alone. Nobody was watching. Nobody else was there. He was not perfectly sure that he was there himself.
en_results: "title": "The Third Policeman", "author": "Flann O'Brien"
vi: Nó nằm sấp, lắng nghe sự im lặng. Nó hoàn toàn cô độc. Không ai trông chừng nó. Không ai khác ở đó cả. Nó không hoàn toàn chắc chắn là chính nó ở đó.
tr: Sessizliği dinleyerek yüzüstü uzandı. Tamamen yalnızdı. Hiç kimse onu izlemiyordu ve orda başka hiç kimse yoktu. Kendisinin bile orda olduğundan tam olarak emin değildi.
es: Se hallaba tumbado boca abajo, completamente solo, escuchando el silencio. Nadie lo vigilaba. No había nadie más. Ni siquiera estaba del todo seguro de estar allí.
es_results: "title": "El Señor de los Anillos", "author": "J.R.R. Tolkien"
vi_translation: It lay face down, listening to the silence. It was completely alone. No one was watching over it. No one else was there. It wasn't entirely sure it was even there itself.
tr_translation: He lay face down, listening to the silence. He was completely alone. No one was watching him and there was no one else there. He wasn't even entirely sure that he himself was there.
es_translation: He was lying face down, completely alone, listening to the silence. No one was watching him. There was no one else. He wasn't even entirely sure he was there.

en: Then a noise reached him through the unformed nothingness that surrounded him: the small soft thumpings of something that flapped, flailed, and struggled. It was a pitiful noise, yet also slightly indecent. He had the uncomfortable feeling that he was eavesdropping on something furtive, shameful.
en_results: "title": "The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle", "author": "Haruki Murakami"
vi: Bỗng nó nghe một tiếng động vang qua khoảng hư vô không định hình chung quanh: tiếng vật vã êm êm nho nhỏ của cái gì đó vỗ vỗ, đập đập, và quẫy đạp. Tiếng động đó nghe rất mủi lòng, nhưng cũng hơi láu táu. Nó có cảm giác khó chịu là nó đang nghe lỏm chuyện gì đó không đứng đắn, đáng xấu hổ.
tr: Ardından onu saran şekilsiz yokluktan bir ses belirdi: hafifçe debelenen ya da çırpınan, sağı solu döven, boğuşan bir şey vardı. Zavallı bir sesti, üstelik uygunsuzdu. Gizli, utanç verici bir şey dinliyormuş gibi rahatsız bir hisse kapıldı.
es: Entonces percibió un ruido a través de la amorfa nada que lo rodeaba: los débiles golpes de algo que se agitaba, se sacudía y forcejeaba. Era un ruidito lastimero, y sin embargo un poco indecoroso. Tuvo la desagradable sensación de estar oyendo a hurtadillas algo secreto, vergonzoso.
es_results: "title": "Cien años de soledad", "author": "Gabriel García Márquez"
vi_translation: Suddenly, it heard a sound echoing through the undefined void around: the soft, gentle rustling and flapping of something beating, tapping, and thrashing. The sound was very touching, but also somewhat hurried. It had an uncomfortable feeling that it was eavesdropping on something improper and shameful.
tr_translation: Then, from the shapeless void that surrounded it, a voice emerged: there was something lightly struggling or flapping, thrashing around, wrestling. It was a pitiful voice, and moreover, it was inappropriate. He felt a sense of discomfort, as if he were listening to something secret and shameful.
es_translation: Then he perceived a noise through the amorphous nothingness that surrounded him: the faint sounds of something stirring, shaking, and struggling. It was a pitiful little noise, and yet somewhat indecorous. He had the unpleasant feeling of eavesdropping on something secret, shameful.

en: Autumn seemed to arrive suddenly that year. The morning of the first of September was crisp as an apple, and as the little family bobbed across the rumbling road toward the great sooty station, the fumes of car exhausts and the breath of pedestrians sparkled like cobwebs in the cold air. Two large cages tattled on top of the laden trolleys the parents were pushing; the owls inside them hooted indignantly, and the redheaded girl trailed fearfully behind here brothers, clutching her father's arm.
en_results: "title": "The Night Circus", "author": "Erin Morgenstern"
vi: Năm đó dường như mùa thu đến đột ngột. Buổi sáng ngày đầu tháng chín giòn rụm như một trái táo, và khi gia đình nho nhỏ nhấp nhô băng qua con đường rần rần xe cộ đi về phía nhà ga lớn đen nhẻm bồ hóng, khói từ ống thải khí xe hơi và hơi thở của những người đi bộ lung linh như mạng nhện trong khí lạnh. Hai cái chuồng bự tổ chảng lắc lư trên mấy chiếc xe đẩy chất đầy hành lý mà cha mẹ đang đẩy; mấy con cú trong chuồng rúc lên một cách giận dữ, và cô bé tóc đỏ mếu máo lẽo đẽo đằng sau mấy người anh, níu chặt lấy cánh tay của người cha.
tr: Güz, o yıl aniden gelmişe benziyordu. Eylül‘ün ilk gününün sabahı, bir elma gibi gevrek ve altın sarısıydı ve küçük aile, kocaman isli istasyona gitmek için sallanarak önlerindeki gürleyen yolu geçerken, arabaların egzoz dumanları ve yayaların nefesleri soğuk havada örümcek ağları gibi parlıyordu. Anne ve baba, yüklerin en üstünde iki geniş, takırdayan kafesin olduğu yük arabasını itiyordu; kafeslerin içindeki baykuşlar vakurla öttü ve babasının koluna yapışan gözleri yaşlı kızıl saçlı kız, ağabeylerinin peşinden gidiyordu.
es: Aquel año, el otoño se adelantó. El primer día de septiembre trajo una mañana tersa y dorada como una manzana, y mientras la pequeña familia cruzaba corriendo la ruidosa calle hacia la enorme y tiznada estación, los gases de los tubos de escape y el aliento de los peatones relucían como telarañas en la fría atmósfera. En lo alto de los dos cargados carritos que empujaban los padres se tambaleaban dos grandes jaulas con sendas lechuzas que ululaban indignadas. Una llorosa niña pelirroja iba detrás de sus hermanos, aferrada al brazo de su padre.
es_results: "title": "El cuaderno de Maya", "author": "Isabel Allende"
vi_translation: That year, autumn seemed to arrive suddenly. The morning of the first day of September was crisp like an apple, and as the small family bobbed across the bustling street towards the large, soot-blackened train station, the smoke from car exhausts and the breath of pedestrians shimmered like spider webs in the cold air. Two enormous cages swayed on the luggage-laden trolleys that the parents were pushing; the owls in the cages hooted angrily, and the red-haired little girl trailed behind her brothers, tearfully clinging to her father's arm.
tr_translation: Autumn seemed to have arrived suddenly that year. The morning of the first day of September was crisp and golden like an apple, and as the small family swayed across the roaring road ahead to reach the large sooty station, the exhaust fumes from the cars and the breaths of the pedestrians sparkled in the cold air like spider webs. The mother and father were pushing a cart laden with goods, on top of which were two large, rattling cages; the owls inside the cages hooted solemnly, and the red-haired girl with tearful eyes clung to her father's arm, following her brothers.
es_translation: That year, autumn came early. The first day of September brought a morning as clear and golden as an apple, and as the small family ran across the noisy street towards the enormous and sooty station, the exhaust fumes and the breath of the pedestrians glistened like cobwebs in the cold atmosphere. On top of the two loaded carts that the parents were pushing, two large cages wobbled with respective owls hooting indignantly. A tearful red-haired girl followed her siblings, clinging to her father's arm.
st: Lehlabula le ne le bonahala le fihlile ka tšohanyetso selemong seo. Hoseng ha la pele la Loetse ho ne ho le crisp joalo ka apole, 'me ha lelapa le lenyenyane le ile la pholletsa le tsela ea ho korotla ho ea seteisheneng se seholo sa sooty, fumes ea mokhathala oa koloi le phefumoloho ea batho ba tsamaeang ka maoto e ne e phophohile joalo ka li-cobwebs moeeng o batang. Li-cage tse peli tse kholo li ile tsa sutumetsa ka holim'a li-trolleys tsa laden, batsoali ba ne ba sutumetsa; 'Me o ile a mo pata ka har'a bona, 'me ngoanana ea khubelu o ile a tsamaea ka tsela e tšabehang ka mor'a moo barab'abo rōna ba, jereng letsoho la ntate oa hae.
yo: Ó dàbí ẹni pé ìgbà ìrọ̀lẹ̀ dé lójijì ní ọdún yẹn. Òwúrọ̀ ọjọ́ àkọ́kọ́ oṣù kẹsàn-án mọ́lẹ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bí apple, àti pé bí ẹbí kékeré náà ṣe ń rìn kọjá ọ̀nà tí ó ń rìn lọ sí ibùdó ẹkún ńlá, èéfín èéfín ọkọ̀ ayọ́kẹ́lẹ́ àti èémí àwọn ẹlẹ́sẹ̀ ń tàn bí kòkòrò nínú afẹ́fẹ́ tútù. Àwọn àgọ́ ńlá méjì wà lórí àwọn kẹ̀kẹ́ tí ó kún fún ẹrù tí àwọn òbí ń tì; Àwọn owl inú wọn ń bínú, ọmọbìnrin aláwọ̀ pupa náà sì tẹ̀lé ẹ̀rù lẹ́yìn àwọn arákùnrin, tí wọ́n di apá bàbá rẹ̀ mú.
tn: Ka tshoganyetso fela, go ne ga tla tshoganyetso fela mo ngwageng oo. Mo mosong wa ntlha wa September e ne e le apole, mme fa lelapa le lennye le ne le tsamaya mo tseleng e e yang kwa seteišeneng se segolo sa sooty, mosi wa letsapa la koloi le mowa wa batsamaya ka dinao o ne wa phatsima jaaka cobwebs mo phefong e e tsididi. Go ne go na le diheketara di le pedi tse di neng di le mo godimo ga dirobedi tse di neng di le mo godimo ga dirobedi tse di neng di le mo go yone, batsadi ba ne ba le mo go yone. Ba ne ba le mo gare ga bone, mme mosetsana yo o mohibidu o ne a tshikinya ka tsela e e boitshegang ka fa morago ga bakaulengwe, a tsenya letsogo la ga rraagwe.
ty: E au ra e ua tae taue mai o Autumn i taua matahiti ra. I te poipoi o te ava'e setepa matamua, ua riro te poipoi o te ava'e setepa ei apara, e a haere noa ' i te utuafare iti na nia i te purumu e tae atu ai i te vahi tapearaa pereoo auahi rahi, ua anaana te mau auauahi o te pereoo e te aho o te feia e haere ra na reira mai te mau apara i roto i te mata'i toetoe. E piti na afata rarahi e tarere ra i ni'a i te mau paero rarahi ta te mau metua e tura'i ra ; ua riri roa te mau fanau'a i roto ia ratou, e ua ou'a ' tura te tamahine e upoo uteute ma te riaria i muri mai i te mau taeae i ǒ nei, ma te tapea i te rima o to ' na metua tane.
mai: ओहि साल शरद ऋतु अचानक आबि गेल बुझाइत छल। सितम्बरक पहिल दिनक भोर सेब जकाँ कुरकुरा छल, आ जेना-जेना छोट परिवार बड़का कालिख स्टेशन दिस घुमैत सड़कक पार घुमैत छल, कारक निकासक धुआँ आ पैदल चलयवलाक साँस ठंढा हवामे कोबला जकाँ चमकैत छल। माता-पिता जे लदल ट्रॉलीकेँ धक्का दऽ रहल छलाह ओकर ऊपर दूटा पैघ पिंजरा लटकल छल। ओकर भीतरक उल्लू क्रोधित भऽ कऽ हूट केलक, आ लाल माथक लड़की अपन पिताक बांहि पकड़ि एतय भाइसभक पाछाँ भयभीत रूपसँ पाछू चलि गेल।
